loans.name: Pura De

texts.es: Pura tiene  56 años de edad, es casada pero esta separada de su esposo que por motivos de trabajo tuvo que irse al exterior, actualmente vive en su casa que es propia. pura se dedica a la elaboracion de pan el mismo que lo comercializa en los negocios de la zona. Su competencia es media pero por la calidad y surtido del producto es muy buscado en la zona, el credito sera destinado como  capital de trabajo, por la epoca  tiene mayor demanda de su producto es por esa razon que solicita el credito. El cumnplimiento de pago en sus anteriores operaciones  fue excelente.
texts.en:
Pura is 56 years old, is married but is separated from her husband, who for job reasons, had to leave. Currently, she lives in her own home. Pura is dedicated to making bread, the same that is sold in area businesses. Her competition is average but the quality and range of the product is highly sought in the area. This loan will be used as working capital. This season, she has greater demand of her product. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. Her payments from her previous operations was excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosalia Rosario

texts.es: Rosalia tiene 44 años de edad, actualemente esta soltera, tiene 2 hijas, pero ninguna depende ella. La vivienda donde vive es propia, pero no cuenta con un documento de respaldo. Rosalia se dedica a la venta de golosinas, como ser caramelos, galletas, chocolates, etc. Y aprovenchando que el mismo esta ubicado al campus universitario, mas propiamente frente a las carreras de medicina y bioquímica, vende tambien artículos tales como guantes, jeringas y otros. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atras. Cerca de su puesto de venta no existen otros negocios similares, por lo tanto no existe mucha competencia. El destino del credito es para capital de operacion, es decir para compra de mercaderia para poder surtir su negocio. Es el tercer credito al que accede Rosalia, siempre mostró un excelente comportamiento en los dos anteriores créditos. No presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 44, and she is currently single. She has two daughters, but they are not dependents. The house where she lives is hers, but she does not have the documents to support this. Rosalia sells sweets like candies, cookies, and chocolates, etc. Because she takes advantage of her location, which is on a university campus in front of the medicine and biochemistry sections, she also sells gloves, syringes, and other things. She has been doing this for a long time. There are no other similar businesses near hers. Therefore, there is not much competition. The loan is for working capital to buy merchandise to stock her business. This is Rosalia’s third loan. She demonstrated excellent behavior with her two previous loans. There has not been any negative behavior on her part in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana que en estos momentos cuenta con 38 años vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, junto a su esposo de 46 y sus tres hijos; de 21-18 y 15 años de edad.
Roxana es promotora de la afamada linea de cosmeticos "avon" desde hace mas de tes años. Su esposo el codeudor es trabajador fijo, seguro y antiguo de una empresa de oleaginosas y derivados. 
Actividades que realizan por varios años, por eso sus experiencias.
La competencia es mediana en cuanto al comercio de cosmeticos, porque hay otras personas con la misma actividad, pero lo importante es que ella es antigua en el negocio y ya tiene sus clientes asegurados. En cuanto a su esposo eso no existe, porque es empleado fijo y seguro.
Roxana invirtio los bs. 2,500,- que saco de la institucion en sus productos avon, la mayoria de los mismos ya los coloco en este pasado "dia de la madre".
Este es el octavo prestamo de la sra. Roxana y todos los anteriores los a cancelado excelentemente. Tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero mismas que se encuentran vigentes, la misma que esta pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Roxana is 38 years old and lives in her own house, located in the western part the city, with her 46 year-old husband and their three children who are 21, 18, and 15.

Roxana has been a representative of the famous Avon cosmetics line for more than three years. Her husband, the cosigner, has a steady, long term job in a company that produces vegetable oils and other derivatives.

They have been working in their jobs for several years so they are both experienced.

There is moderate competition in the cosmetics business because there are other people who sell the same products, but the important thing is that Roxana is established in the business and already has loyal customers. In regard to her husband’s work, this does not exist, because he is a permanent and secure employee. Roxana invested the BS 2,500 (Bolivian Currency) that she received from this institution in Avon products, most of which she already sold for Mothers Day.

This is Roxana’s 8th loan and she paid off all of her previous loans successfully. She has other debts in the same financial system that are still active and being paid back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of Avon products

loans.name: Rosandra Maria

texts.es: Rosandra María Salmerón D. tiene 36 años de edad, Rosandra es casada. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es un taller de costura. Hace más de  21 años que se dedica a este negocio.ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante pero tuvo un sin numero de problemas ya que uno de sus hijos estaba muy enfermo por loq ue algunas veces tenia que descuidar su negocio y acudir a su hijo, pero este problema no la detuvo paar que siguiera con este negocio. el motivo del financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de tela, tijeras, agujas, hilo entre otras cosas. el sueño de Rosandra es mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Rosandra María Salmerón D. is 36 years old and married. She has 3 children and all of them are in school.

Rosandra works in a tailoring shop. For more than 21 years she has worked in this business, which she began in order to get ahead in life. She had an innumerable amount of problems because one of her children was very sick so several times she had to neglect her business and attend to her son, but this problem did not stop her from continuing with her business.

The loan will be used as working capital to purchase fabric, scissors, needles and thread, among other things. Rosandra’s dream is to continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio no es casado, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de guardia de seguridad, la hija se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos Yanbal, Lbel y Avon. Claudio es empleado y la hija vende productos de cosmeticos desde hace 5 años atrás. La competencia es alta, pero cuentan con clientela fija de las distintas oficinas de la ciudad, el cliente es empleado de seguridad. Claudio refaccionara su vivienda y parte del credito es para capital de operaciones de la hija que es vendedora de cosmeticos. Es el cuarto  credito al que accede Claudio. Ha demostrado permanentemente buen cumplimiento y pago oportuno de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Claudio is not married. He works as a security guard and his daughter sells Yanbal, Lbel and Avon cosmetics. Claudio is an employee and his daughter has been selling cosmetics for the past 5 years. There is a lot of competition but they can count on loyal customers from various neighborhoods in the city.

Claudio will refurbish his house and part of the loan is for working capital for his daughter. This is Claudio’s fourth loan. He has always shown himself to live up to his obligations and timely in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish house and for cosmetics sales.

loans.name: Rosalinda De Constancia Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Rosalinda D. Constancia pertenece a la Comunidad D. Pampas-Constancia del distrito D. Lircay ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad se dedica a la crianza D. vacunos y ganados, algunas se dedican al tejido, pero la mayoría son agricultores, es su imagen fuente D. ingresos.

Bertha Lucila es casada, tiene 4 hijos D. 10, 9, 8 y un bebe D. 11 meses, su negocio es una tienda D. abarrotes, se inició con un capital pequeño, el negocio lo maneja ella misma, su esposo por falta D. trabajo se fue a laborar a la mina. Ha solicitado un préstamo D. 500 soles que invertirá en su tienda para la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, surtirlo D. muchas cosas, para tener más ventas y más ganancias.

Reymunda es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 17 y 12 años, ella tiene una tienda donD. venD. dulces, galletas, refrescos, chupetines, chiclets, etc. Primero vendía ambulatoriamente en los estadios y actividades, posteriormente puso su tienda. Solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. golosinas, Reymunda quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y logre mejorar su vivienda.

Rosa es casada y tiene 6 hijos, en su tienda D. abarrotes venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, se inició hace 30 años con el apoyo D. su esposo e iniciativa D. sus hijos. Solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. productos para su tienda, le gustaría ser más independiente con su dinero, sus ahorros lo usara para mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Rosalinda D. Constancia" belongs to the community of Pampas-constancia in the district of Lircay located in the department of Huancavelica. This community raises livestock and some weave, but most of its members are agricultural farmers and this is their primary source of income. Bertha Lucila is married, she has four children aged 10, 9, 8 and a baby of 11 months. She runs a grocery store, which she begun with a small amount of capital and manages herself because her husband due to a lack of work has left to work in the mines. She has asked for a loan of 500 soles to invest in her shop to purchase essential goods such as rice, sugar and oil. Her dream is to improve her business and to stock many more things in order to have higher sales and more income. Reymunda is married, she has three children aged 22, 17 and 12. She has a shop where she sells sweets, biscuits, soft drinks, candy, gum etc. She used to be a walking salesperson in the stadiums and at events, but later she established her own shop. She is asking for a loan of 600 soles in order to buy snacks. Reymunda wants to continue helping her children so that they can be professionals and better their lives. Rosa is married and has 6 children, in her grocery shop she sells all sorts of essential products. She started some 30 years ago with the help of her husband and the encouragement of their children. She is asking for a loan of 600 soles in order to purchase products for her shop. She would like to be more independent with her money and will use her savings to improve her home and help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to stock businesses

loans.name: Cristina De

texts.es: Cristina tiene 43 años,cuenta con 4 hijos (de 25, 20, 18 y 17 años), casada, cuyo esposo se encuentra en argentina trabajando. Todos sus hijos participan en el negocio por lo que es una actividad unifamiliar. Cuenta con casa propia dotada de todos los servicios basicos. Su negocio es la compra de maiz amarillo y cubano blanco en quntales, para luego comercializarlo procesado (pelado con cal) a los diferentes puestos de venta del mercado german moreno y villa barrientos contando con 14 años de experiencia en el rubro. No cuenta con mucha competencia ya que cuenta con clientes seguros que le hacen pedidos. El credito tiene como destino la compra de mayor cantidad de maiz aprovechando el precio bajo del grano en la epoca. Cristina es cliente desde el año 2007, con 3 creditos en la institucion y con pagos puntuales, la misma que tiene credito tan solo con nosotros sin embargo con experiencia en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
Cristina is 43 years old and has four children (aged 25, 20, 18 and 17). She is married and her husband is in Argentina working. All her children help with the business, which is a family affair. She has her own home which is supplied with all the basic services. Cristina works purchasing yellow and white Cuban maize in 100kg lots and then processing it (pounding it with lime) for commercial use and selling it at different stalls in the "German Moreno" and "Villa Barrientos" markets. She has 14 years experience in the business. She doesn't have much competiion and she has a secure customer base who place orders with her. The loan will be used to purchase maize wholesale, taking advantage of the low grain prices right now. Cristina has been a client since 2007, with three loans from the organization all of which have been repaid punctually. Also, she only has loans with us, although she does have experience of other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital with which to buy Maize

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio Cesar es soltero, de 42 años de edad, con 4 hijos (2 en la universidad, 2 estudiando la primaria) con 5 años de servicio en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como ayudante de maquinaria pesada, con horario de 7am. a 5 pm. de lunes a viernes, el fin de semana lo tiene libre, ademas del salario de la Alcaldia, cuenta con una pension del INSS, su compañera de vida trabaja y tiene un ingreso mensual con el que aporta a los gastos del hogar.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito para compra de zin, madera y cemento, cambiara el techo de su casa, ya que con el invierno su familia se esta mojando y quiere componer un poco el techo y sentirse mas seguro evitando el riesgo de enfermarse.  Manifiesta que no tiene credito en ninguna institucion financiera y se ha acercado a AFODENIC por recomendaciones de sus compaleros de labores, que consideran que los intereses y la atencion de sus funcionarios es excelente.
texts.en:
Don Julio Cesar is single, aged 42 with four children (two at university, two studying in primary school) and has spent five years working for the mayoralty of Juigalpa, working with heavy machinery from 7am to 5pm Monday to Friday. He has the weekends off, and in addition to the salary from the Alcaldia, he draws a social security pension and his partner works and has a monthly income which helps with the household expenses. He is asking for his first loan in order to buy zinc, wood and cement. He will change the roof of his house, as in the winter his family is getting wet and he wants to repair the roof a little and make it more secure in order to avoid the risk of them falling ill. He has demonstrated that he doesn't have a loan at any other financial institution and he approached AFODENIC because of his work colleagues' recommendations who consider that the interest and attention shown by its workers are excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en la casa de sus padres, pues aún no logran comprar un terreno donde construir su casa propia. Su familia se dedicaba a la venta de productos agrícolas en el mercado central de la ciudad, donde él trabajaba para ayudar a sus padres; actualmente, se asoció con ellos para iniciar su propio negocio, ya que ahora tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su nueva familia. Desde entonces, hace 2 años, vende choclo en el mismo mercado, actividad que le demanda muchas horas de sacrificio; puesto que desde las 3 de la madrugada sale de casa rumbo a su puesto para vender sus productos hasta el medio día. Asimismo, Ángel se mantiene en contacto con sus proveedores, quienes son agricultores de otras provincias que le brindan los productos a menor precio; pero si quiere conseguir aún menores costos viaja hasta esos lugares para adquirir productos en grandes cantidades y de mejor calidad. Para un futuro cercano, Ángel quiere tener un depósito donde mantener seguros sus productos. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde su compromiso está ligado a su crecimiento económico, con una base de responsabilidad y trabajo. Con los 3000 soles que solicita viajará a una provincia del interior del país para comprar, al por mayor, los productos que necesita.
texts.en:
Ángel is 33 years old and he lives together with his wife and his son in the house of his parents, because they still haven't managed to buy a plot on which to build their own house. His family used to sell agricultural products in the central town market, where he used to work helping his parents. Now, he has clubbed together with them in order to start-up his own business, as he now has responsibility to watch over his new family. As a result, for the last two years he has sold corn in the same market, an activity which requires many hours of sacrifice. At 3 in the morning he leaves the house and heads to his stall to sell his produce until midday. In this way, Ángel maintains contact with his providers who are farmers from other provinces who provide the produce at a low price. However, if he wants to obtain even lower costs he travels to these places to acquire better-quality produce in larger quantities. In the short-term, Ángel wants to have a store where he can keep his goods securely. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, where his commitment is attached to his economic growth, based upon responsibility and hard-work. With the 3000 soles which he is asking for he will travel to a province in the interior of the country in order to buy, wholesale, the produce he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es: Walter es casado, de 28 años de edad, su esposa Yessenia Cerna Miranda de 23 años, no trabaja fuera, pero en la casa realiza todas las labores y cuida a su hijo de 2 años.   El trabaja en la alcaldia de Juigalpa como obrero ayudante de ejecucion y mantenimiento de proyectos desde hace 10 años.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construccion como zinc, perlines, cemento para embaldozar, comprar puertas y ventanas si el dinero ajusta; el levanto paredes con el credito anterior, pero no fue reportado como Kiva, en eta oportunidad fue favorecido por este organismo y se siente muy contento porque de esta manera dara continuidad a su vivienda hasta el sueño de su vida dar una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is married: he is 28 years old and his wife Yessenia Cerna Miranda is 23 years old. She doesn't work, but looks after all the household chores and cares for their 2 year old son. He works in the town of Juigalpa assisting with the execution and maintenance of projects for the last 10 years. He is asking for his second credit which he will use to buy construction materials such as zinc, purlins, cement for tiling, and to purchase doors and windows if the money allows. He put up walls with the previous credit, but this wasn't reported on Kiva. This time, he has been favoured by this organization and he is very happy because as a result he will be able to continue improving his home until he realises his life's dream of providing his family with a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Mary Scorly

texts.es: Mary tiene un puesto de venta en plena avenida es decir en la zona central, en su lugar de venta ofrece billeteras, fundas de celulares de cuero, también  surte con  las fundas de cámaras fotográficas. Mary vive en casa de sus papas desde hace 10 años atrás, su principal actividad es la producción y comercialización de artículos en cuero. Mary  cuenta con experiencia de 8 años en el rubro, en la producción y comercialización de su mercadería actualmente la madre de Mary viaja las ferias a vender los productos de su hija. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado, ella tiene su propia clientela ya que tiene el don de atención al cliente y experiencia a lo largo de los años de venta en el puesto. Generalmente compra a un precio fijo la materia prima  como ser cuero por rollo, tela chapa, adornos, tinta broche y aceite para maquina. Mary no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni el buro de infocred, al contrario cuenta con un buen historial crediticio en los créditos anteriores.
texts.en:
Mary has a sales location in the central zone, where she sells wallets, leather cell phone covers, and also camera covers. Mary has been living in her parents’ house for 10 years; its main activity is the production of leather goods. Mary counts on her 8 years of experience in heading production and commercialization of its merchandise. At the moment Mary’s mother travels to the fairs to sell her daughter’s products. Although competition in the market exists, she has her own customers because she pays attention to the client and her selling experience throughout the years. She generally buys the raw materials at a fixed price, such as leather by roll, fabric plates, adornments, dye clasps and oil for the machine. Mary does not have negative history with risks nor in the bureau of Infocred, on the contrary, she has good credit history with the previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather & fasteners at wholesale

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: El señor José Humberto B., tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio , junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas y las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos, de 19,18,15 años, todos estudiante de secundaria y en tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 20 años don José se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar el cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha. Da las gracia Afodenic por la facilidad de pago y por las proyecciones que esta logrando con los financiamiento.
texts.en:
José Humberto B. is 49 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighbourhood with his wife who helps him with the farm and house work. They have three children who are 19, 18 and 15 years old; they all attend secondary school and help out on the farm in their free time. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions.
José has worked in agriculture for 20 years and crop infestations have been the biggest problem. He will purchase fertilisers and supplies that will produce a good harvest. He thanks Afodenic for their easy repayment terms and for giving him the financing that is helping him achieve his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilisers for his crops

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena tiene 47 años, es madre de un hijo de 20 años por quien se esfuerza para brindarle lo necesario para su educación, a pesar de no tener una casa propia tiene el sueño de adquirir una pronto y dejar de pagar alquileres. Desde que su pareja la abandonó tuvo la valentía de salir adelante sola trabajando como costurera, oficio que viene realizando por más de 20 años. En sus inicios trabajó en su casa recibiendo algunos pedidos de sus vecinos para arreglar sus prendas; posteriormente, la municipalidad abrió un mercado en el distrito donde vivía y supo aprovechar la oportunidad para adquirir un puesto, donde viene trabajando desde hace 10 años. Azucena atiende a sus clientes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, ahora que es más conocida y tiene gran cantidad de clientes está pensando ampliar su puesto aprovechando la disponibilidad de los que tiene al costado y están en venta. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, la responsabilidad y el empeño son cualidades que comparte con sus compañeras de banco comunal, con quienes ha aprendido a desenvolverse en los ámbitos sociales y comerciales. Los 2000 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir telas y herramientas para desarrollar mejor los acabados de sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Azucena (Lily) is a 47 years old mother with a 20 year old son for whom she works hard to offer him what is necessary for his education, despite not having her own house she has the dream of acquiring one soon and to let go of paying rent. Ever since her partner left her, she had the bravery to move forward alone working as a seamstress, a trade she has made for more than 20 years. In the beginning, she worked at home receiving some orders from her neighbors to fix their garments; later, the municipality opened a market in the district where she lived and she knew to take advantage of the opportunity to acquire a place, where she has been working for 10 years. Azucena (Lily) takes care of her clients from 8 in the morning to 10 at night. Now that she is more well-known and has a great amount of clients, she is thinking of extending her place, taking advantage of the availability of what is for sale to her side. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas PRISM, responsibility and persistence are qualities that she shares with her companions of the communal bank, with those who have learned to develop themselves in the social and commercial scopes. The 2000 soles that she asks for will allow her to acquire fabrics and tools to better develop her tailoring.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, a sus 31 años tiene que asumir su rol de madre y de padre para su hijo quien es la razón de ser en su vida, y con el apoyo de su sobrino quien vive en su casa puede estar pendiente de su hijo. Desde que se separó de su pareja tuvo que buscar la forma de ganarse la vida sola y encontró en la venta de prendas íntimas una forma  de salir adelante. Estas prendas las compra en el mercado central de la ciudad o en las fábricas, pues los precios son muy cómodos y le permiten tener ganancias considerables. A pesar de ser muy cansada su labor no deja de salir todos los días por las mañanas a la puerta del mercado donde tiene alquilado un espacio y donde muy alegremente oferta su mercadería hasta el medio día. Adicionalmente, vende pescado los fines de semana en el mercado mayorista de su distrito. Carmen espera que los ahorros que ha ido acumulando le permitan pronto conseguir un puesto estable en el mercado para dejar de exponerse al peligro debido a la delincuencia que hay en la zona. Este es su cuarto crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, junto a sus compañeras de banco comunal trabajar arduamente para incrementar sus ganancias y hasta la fecha el equipo de trabajo que conformaron viene funcionando responsablemente. Con los 1200 soles que solicita comprará prendas para la temporada de invierno y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Carmen has to assume the role of mother and father for her son, who is her reason for living. With the help of her nephew, who lives in her house, she can be devoted to her son. After separating from her husband, she had to look for a way to earn a living by herself. She found that selling intimate garments was a way to get ahead. She buys the garments in the central market of the city or in the factories. The prices are very good and they allow her to have considerable earnings. In spite of being very tired from her work, every morning she goes to the entry of the market. She has a rented space there where she happily offers her merchandise until midday. Also, on the weekends she sells fish in the wholesale market in her district . Carmen hopes that the savings she has been accumulating will allow her to get a stable place in the market so that she will no longer be exposed to the danger of the delinquency that exists in her zone. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Together with her colleagues from the community bank, she works arduously to increase her earnings. The work team they comprise is functioning very responsibly. The 1,200 PEN will be used to buy garments for the winter. This way she will increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: La señora Dora cuaresma , tiene la edad de 46 años , habita en el barrio Cebadilla , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene  cinco hijos , dos ya son casados e independiente ; pero le apoyan y tres que están a su cargo de 17,15,12 años actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Dora desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , las plagas que afectan a los cultivos ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios . El plan futuro hacia sus cultivos es poder darle un mejor mantenimiento, para poder vender a un buen precio. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo.
texts.en:
Dora is 46 years old, and lives in the Cebadilla neighborhood with her husband, who works to help with the expenses. They have five children. Two are married and independent, but they support them, and three (ages 17, 15, and 12 - all students) are still under their parents' care.

Dora's plan for her family is to improve their quality of life. For 21 years, Dora has worked in agriculture. The biggest difficulty is the lack of funding and the plagues that affect the crops as she lacks the necessary fertilizers and supplies.

Her plan for the future is to be able to better manage her crops so that she may sell them at a good price. With the funding obtained through this loan, she will buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Taritolay

texts.es: Taritolay se dedica a la Fruticultura (durazno, peramota, damasco, manzana y tuna). Taritolay no solo cultiva esta producción también la comercializa en diferentes localidades aledañas a donde el vive. La venta de frutas generalmente esta concentrada  en los mercados de las ciudades principales y ocasionalmente en Cochabamba. Taritolay  radica en una comunidad lejana desde hace 43 años atrás, junto a su familia el codeudor es el hermano del titular ambos trabajan juntos en la comunidad dedicándose íntegramente al chonteo y cuidado de  frutales en su comunidad. También cuenta con cuarenta años de experiencia en su actividad actualmente el negocio con el que tiene es el cultivo y la cosecha de  la variedad de frutas en el ciclo potencialmente productivo durante 6 mese s al año. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado, él tiene su propia clientela ya que por la forma de atender a sus clientes y principalmente la calidad y puntualidad en la entrega de frutas a sus clientes es la mas preferida tomando en cuenta el mercado seguro. No existe un precio fijo en las compras de  la variedad de frutas, este varía de acuerdo al ciclo productivo del año. El prestatario no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni en el buro de informes confidenciales.
texts.en:
Taritolay grows fruit (peaches, pears, plums, apples and prickly pear). Taritolay not only grows this fruit but also sells it in different local villages near his home. The sale of most fruit usually takes place in the central markets of larger cities and occasionally in Cochabamba. Taritolay has lived in a remote community for forty-three years, near his family and his brother, with whom he applied for this loan.. Both men work together in the village dedicating themselves to growing palm trees for wood and caring for their fruit trees. They have forty years of experience in the maintenance and harvest of fruit.

The prime fruit growing cycle lasts six months of the year. While he has success in the farmers' market, which he attributes to the attention he gives to his customers and the quality and timeliness of the delivery of his fruit, he would like to always be dependable. The price of the fruit varies according to the time of the year.

The borrower does not have previous bad debt or bad reports with the credit bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 55 años, su afán de progreso como familia es su prioridad, teniendo a su esposo y a sus hijos como su mayor motivador. Al casarse sus condiciones económicas eran precarias; pero con mucho esfuerzo, ella y su esposo, luego de muchos años de ejercer diversos oficios han lograron superarse, logrando implementar desde hace 3 meses su propia ferretería. Y en este corto tiempo de funcionamiento han logrado captar gran cantidad de clientes debido a que es la única ferretería en su barrio. Empiezan su trabajo todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, atendiendo muy amablemente a las personas que ingresan a su establecimiento; además, llevan los materiales a las viviendas de sus clientes como un servicio adicional. Este negocio esta en pleno crecimiento y esperan que con el tiempo puedan ser proveedores para muchas obras de construcción en su distrito. Este es el 9no crédito de Josefina con Microfinanzas PRISMA, su tiempo de permanencia ha significado su crecimiento a nivel comercial y dentro de su banco comunal, gracias al esfuerzo y compromiso de cada una de sus compañeras. Los 3500 soles que solicita le servirán para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, pues comprará aquellos artículos que aun no tiene en su ferretería, para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old. Her main goal in life is to make sure her family prospers. Her husband and her children are her main source of motivation. When she got married, her and her husband's economic situation was precarious, but they both worked hard and after many years of working a variety of jobs they have been able to get ahead. Three months ago they were able to start their own hardware store. And in this short time they have been able to attract many new customers since it is the only hardware shop in their neighborhood. Everyday Josefina and her husband start working at 7 in the morning and they finish work at 9 at night. They have great customer service and they even deliver items to their customers as an additional service. Their business is growing and they hope that over time they will become the main suppliers of construction materials in their area. This is the 9th loan that Josefina has obtained through Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her time in the communal bank has helped her to grow as a small business person and she is also strongly committed to helping her follow members of the communal bank to grow and prosper. The $1,175 that she is requesting will help her to fill the orders that her clients have made. She will also be able to increase the stock of her hardware store to include items that they presently do not carry.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy optimista y preocupada por el progreso de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Desde muy joven estuvo involucrada en el comercio de productos de segunda mano, pero al casarse, junto a su esposo tuvieron la idea de comprar un auto; entonces, ambos juntaron sus ahorros y adquirieron uno de segunda mano, con el que ahora trabajan brindado el servicio de transporte de carga interprovincial y justamente en este momento su movilidad se encuentra en otra ciudad. En este negocio Martha se encarga de la administración de las ganancias y de mantener en buen estado el auto, procurando su revisión mecánica periódicamente. Su deseo a futuro es adquirir otros autos para tener una flota de transporte de carga, ya que este negocio le está resultando muy rentable y de gran demanda. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, la permanencia en su banco comunal le ha permitido desarrollar habilidades que desconocía en ella, las cuales han aflorado con el apoyo de todas sus compañeras, quienes trabajan organizadamente y con suma responsabilidad. Los 2000 soles que ahora solicita son muy importantes para su negocio, ya que tendrá la posibilidad de completar el monto para adquirir un auto adicional e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha is 57 years old. She is a very optimistic woman and worried about the progress of her family, which is comprised of her husband and their 3 children. Since she was very young she has been involved in the business of second hand products. When she married, she and her husband had the idea to buy a car, so both joined their savings and acquired a second hand one, which they now work with offering a transport service for interstate cargo. Precisely at this moment their mobility is in another city. In this business Martha is charged with the administration of the profits and maintaining the car in a good state, trying to do mechanical inspections periodically. Her wish for the future is to acquire other cars to have a cargo transport fleet, now that this business is resulting in being profitable and in great demand. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. The continuance of her communal bank has permitted her to develop skills she was unaware of, which have blossomed with the support of her colleagues, who work in an organised way and with responsibility. The 2000 soles that she is requesting now are very important for her business, as she will now have the possibility to finish the total amount to acquire an additional car and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the amount neccesary to buy a car

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos. La vivienda donde habita es prestada, es decir, es de su familia que vive en la paz, ellos cuidan la casa. Simona se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atras. Cuenta con muchos clientes. el esposo de Simona, es propietario de un vehiculo que lo hace trabajar de taxi.  El nivel de competencia es alto, ya que existen varios puestos de venta de comida. El destino del credito es para capital de operacion, compra al por mayor de ingredientes que ella usa con mas frecuencia en sus comidas. Como ser arroz, fideo y otros. Es el tercer credito al que accede Simona, en los dos anteriores creditos mostro un buen comportamiento. Si ancedentes negativos en el sistema financiero
texts.en:
Simona is 50 years old, married, and has 2 children. The home that she lives in is barrowed, that is to say, it belongs to family members that currently live in La Paz; Simona and her family take care of the home. Simona dedicates herself to the sale of food in the market, an activity that she has carried out for many years; she has many clients. Simona’s husband owns a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. Simona has a lot of competition given that there are many food stands. The loan will be used for operation capital to purchase ingredients wholesale that she uses frequently in her food such as rice, noodles, and other items. This is the third loan that Simona has requested, and in both previous loans she exemplified good behavior and had no negative past credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to purchase ingredients wholesale).

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Felipe Santiago Hernández Solís tiene 36 años de edad. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Felipe es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 36 años que se dedica a este negocio. El comenzó este negocio porque tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos y además tenía la necesidad de trabajar ya que siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, a Felipe le encanta su trabajo ya que se distrae recorriendo las calles y además conversa con sus clientes y sen encarga de que se encuentren cómodos. El financiamiento solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos para su carro. El sueño de Felipe es mantener su negocio ya que en este es muy difícil mantenerla por le precio del combustible.
texts.en:
Felipe Santiago Hernández Solís is 36 years old. He has 5 children in his care and they are all in school. His main source of income is running a taxi service. He started his taxi business 36 years ago. He started his business because he need to provide for his children and he need a stable job since he has always been a very responsible man. Felipe loves his job and he has fun driving through the streets of his town and talking to his customer. He always wants them to feel comfortable. The loan for $650 that Felipe is requesting will be used to buy parts for his taxi. Felipe's dream is to keep his business doing well despite the high cost of fuel. (Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron conseguir. Ahora está tratando de mejorar su vivienda para la comodidad de sus hijos. Desde que se casó buscó la forma de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar realizando diversas actividades, gracias al esfuerzo de tantos años logró instalar una tienda dentro de su casa donde se siente a gusto en compañía de sus seres queridos, quienes le tienden una mano para la atención. Su negocio está abierto desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la media noche, debido al consumo masivo que hay por las noches, tratando siempre de brindar la mejor atención. Mónica está muy contenta con su tienda y espera seguir creciendo e implementar algunos espacios para exhibir sus productos según su tipo y así ofrecer mayor comodidad  a sus clientes. Este es su 10mo préstamo con microfinanzas PRISMA y hasta la fecha, junto a sus compañeras, vienen trabajando con responsabilidad y compromiso; ya que sus objetivos finales son el crecimiento económico dentro de su banco comunal. Con los 3000 soles que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su negocio con productos nuevos y de mejor calidad para brindar prestigio a su local.
texts.en:
Mónica is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children in a house that they worked hard to buy. Now she is trying to make improvements to her home so that her children will be more comfortable. Since she got married she has helped her husband with the household expenses by doing a variety of jobs. Thanks to her hard work over many years she has been able to open a small store inside of her home where she can always feel at ease because she can work at the store and be with her loved ones at the same time. They also help her with the store. She opens her business at 6 in the morning and closes it at midnight, since she has a rush of customers at night and she wants to be available to serve them. Mónica is very happy about her store and she hopes that it will continue to grow. She would like additional space to display her products according to the type of products. This is the 10th loan that she has received through microfinanzas PRISMA and she and her fellow members have worked responsibly and with a lot of dedication, since their goal is the economic growth inside of their communal bank. With the $1,000 that Mónica is requesting she will acquire more merchandise to stock her business with new products and better quality products so that she may bring prestige to her store.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Maria del Socorro U. M. tiene 42 años de edad es casada con 3 hijos dos menores y una mayor de edad, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de ropa usada, en donde compra pacas de pantalones, camisetas, shorts, blusas de mujer y hasta sabanas.

Este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados ya que ella tiene una familiar en la capital y logra conseguir pacas de ropa de calidad, la cual se vende bastante ya que muchas personas prefieren comprar este tipo de ropa por la calidad y el precio. Esta microempresaria ya ha sido beneficiada por parte de Kiva con dos créditos anteriores a este y los ha pagado en tiempo y forma.

Actualmente esta solicitando a los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayuden con el financiamiento de: 1 Paca de camisetas la cual compra a US 230 la paca, 1 paca de  pantalones jeans a US 260 la paca  y 1 paca de  blusas para damas a US 210 la paca,  todos de  ropa usada.
texts.en:
Microentreprenuer Maria del Socorro U. M. is 42, married, has 2 minor children, and one older child. For six years she has been selling used clothes that come with pants, shirts, shorts, women’s blouses, and even sheets packed in bulk. This business has brought her good results. She has a relative in the capital who is able to get her quality bulk clothing. She sells a lot since many people prefer buying this type of clothing for the quality and the price. She has received two previous loans from Kiva, she repaid them on time and as agreed upon. She is currently asking the Kiva lenders to help her buy: 1 bulk package of shirts for US 230 per pack, 1 bulk pack of jeans at US 260 per pack, and 1 bulk pack of women’s blouses at US 210 per pack. All of the packs contain used clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk packages of used clothes containing shirts, jeans, and women's blouses

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ligia del Socorro B., tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto con sus compañero de vida, el cual trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos a su cargo, una hija de 19 años , y una varón de cuatro años , los dos estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , poder dividir los cuartos , ella desde hace siete años trabaja como comerciante , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las ventas bajas , ya que hasta casi el 50% de mercadería tienen descuento .Con el Financiamiento va a comprar nuevos productos de moda tanto ropa , como bisutería y zapatos. Para ofertar a sus clientes productos de variedad.
texts.en:
Ligia del Socorro Balando, 39, lives in the Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla together with her life mate. He works to help her with the household expenses. They care for two children, a 19 year old daughter and a 4 year old son. Both children currently attend school. The plans for the family are to improve their living conditions and be able to divide the rooms. She has been a storekeeper for seven years. The biggest difficulties that present themselves are the lack of financing and the low sales. Almost 50% of the merchandise is discounted. She will use the loan to buy new fashion products like clothes, jewelry, and shoes. She will then offer her customers variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, and jewelry

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married with one small child. He sells clothing and shoes at a local open market in his city. He also goes out to neighboring villages to sell. Roman has been in this business for four years. His monthly profit is 3,000 UAH. He has many consistent clients, especially in villages where there are no markets. Sometimes he takes orders then brings the items to customers when he returns to the village.

Roman would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase his inventory. He hopes to take better care of his family's needs. His goal is to open his own little store in his city.

loans.use: Increase his inventory.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en la actividad; trabaja como supervisor de calidad; es casado, tiene casa propia, cuenta con siete hijos. Su esposa trabaja con el en la confección de chamarras.
Cuenta con el negocio de confección de chamarras en general juntamente con la esposa, con experiencia de 8 años y cuenta con un ingreso como supervisor de calidad en la empresa mabet s.a. con antigüedad de siete años.
Su competencia en el mercado es media ya que comercializa a la clientela específica con la que cuenta en diferentes lugares. (no cuenta con puesto fijo de venta).
El destino del crédito fue para capital de operación (compra de material de trabajo).
Es su cuarto crédito en la institución, cuenta con crédito en otras entidades financieras con antigüedad de 26 meses, lo cual es cliente antigüo en ambas instituciones.
texts.en:
Celso has 7 years of business experience working as a quality supervisor. He is married, has 7 children, and owns his own home. His wife works as a seamstress, manufacturing jackets. Having worked with his wife in the jacket business for 8 years, he started a new job as a quality supervisor at a company called MABET, S.A., where he has now has seven years of seniority.

His competition is half of what it normally would be in the open marketplace because he sells his jackets directly to specific vendors in different locations (and he does not have to maintain a fixed retail space).

His loan will be used for operating capital (to purchase working equipment). This is his fourth loan with Fundación Agrocapital. He has taken out prior loans with another financial institution over the past 26 months, and he is still a long-time customer at both places.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 41 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en un cuarto alquilado, ya que sus recursos económicos no le permiten adquirir un terreno en la ciudad y espera que con el  esfuerzo de cada miembro de la familia puedan realizar el sueño de la casa propia. Desde que era soltera trabajaba para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, ahora casada trabajar para mantener su propio hogar. Hace 8 años viene vendiendo ropa en la puerta del mercado de su distrito, donde la encontramos todas las mañanas desde las 8 hasta el medio día,  hora que retorna a su casa para realizar sus actividades domésticas. Adicionalmente, cada mes, se traslada a otras provincias llevando pedidos de ropa, las cuales entrega a crédito y así obtiene mejores ganancias puesto que los precios son mayores debido a la distancia que tiene que recorrer para llevar lo solicitado. Para un futuro, Tania ansia tener un puesto de ventas estable para vender cómodamente y conseguir la sostenibilidad de su negocio. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y como miembro de su banco comunal trabaja con esmero y entusiasmo para realizar los objetivos que comparte con todas sus compañeras. Con los 1000 soles que solicita incrementará su mercadería, pues requiere de variedad de prendas para llevarlas a provincias este fin de mes.
texts.en:
Tania is 41, married, and has two children. She lives in a rented room. Her economic resources do not allow her to acquire land in the city. She hopes that with the effort of each member of her family, they will be able to fulfill the dream of having their own house. When she was single she worked to help her mother with the household expenses. Now that she is married, she works to support her own household. For eight years she has been selling clothes in the entrance to the market in her district. She is there every morning from eight until midday. Then she returns home to perform her domestic chores. Also, every month she travels to other provinces delivering orders of clothing. She sells them on credit, and that way her earnings are better. The prices are higher due to the distance she has to cover to deliver the order. In the future, Tania is anxious to have a stable place to sell comfortably and be able to sustain her business. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. As a member of her community bank, she works carefully and enthusiastically to meet the objectives that she shares with her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN to increase her merchandise. She needs a variety of articles to take to the provinces at the end of this month.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La microempresaria Juana Maria M. A. tiene 39 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos, todos se encuentran estudiando y desde hace muchos años administra una pulpería en un sector periférico de esta ciudad en donde vende granos básicos, gaseosas y otros productos variados. Todos estos productos los compra en esta ciudad de Bluefields por lo que la ganancia es muy poca, por lo que requiere trasladarse a la capital Managua para poder encontrar precios mas bajos.
Cabe mencionar que la señora M. ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos anterior con Kiva, los cuales le han permitido ir haciendo algunas mejoras en su vivienda, tales como la reparación de techo pudiendo cambiar casi el 100 % del zinc de su casa.
En esta ocasión solicita se le financie para la compra de los siguientes productos:
3 quintales de Arroz nacional los compra a US 50 cada quintal,  3 cajas de sopa de vaso a US 26 cada caja, 1 quintal de  frijoles a US34 el quintal, 2 cajas de  leche la lechera a US 30 cada caja, 2 bidones de  aceite a US 25 cada bidón, 2 quintales de harina a US 40 cada quintal, 4 cajillas de  Huevos a US 12 cada cajilla, 4 cajas de sopa maruchan a US 10 cada caja, 4 cajas de  jabón de lavar a US 25 cada caja y 2 quintales de  azúcar a US 30 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Juana Maria M. A. is a 39 year old small business entrepreneur. She is married and has four children who are all in school. For many years she has run a mini market in a sector outlying the city. She sells basic grains, soft drinks, and other various products. She buys all of the products in the city of Bluefields, and she earns very little. That means she needs to go to the capital, Managua, to be able to find lower prices. Juana has had two previous loans with Kiva. With those loans she has been making some improvements on her house like fixing the roof by changing almost 100% of the zinc. She will use this loan to buy the following products: 3 quintales (a quintal is equivilent to 46kg, or 100 lbs.) of National rice @ US 50 per quintal, 3 boxes of soup in jars @ US 26 per box, 1 quintal of beans @ US 34 per quintal, 2 boxes of La Lechera milk @ US 30 per box, 2 cans of oil @ US 25 per can, 2 quintales of flour @ US 40 per quintal, 4 cartons of eggs @ US 12 per carton, 4 boxes of Maruchan soup @ US 10 per box, 4 boxes of laundry detergent @ US 25 per box, and 2 quintales of sugar @ US 30 per quintal.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy National rice, jars of soup, beans, La Lechera milk, oil, flour, eggs, Maruchan soup, laundry detergent and sugar

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos C. tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y artículos nuevos y usados en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, esté es el ingreso que genera para darle lo mejor a su hijo ya que es madre soltera.
   Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para ser esa inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para realizar la compra de la mercancía y así su negocio tendrá mas ingreso.
texts.en:
For over two years Santos C. has been selling clothes and new and used articles in the city of Nuevo Laredo. She is a single mother, and this is the income she generates to give her son the best. The business is lacking more variety of merchandise. At this time, she lacks the funds necessary to make this investment, and she doesn't want to leave the business under-capitalized. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise. This way her business will have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Tayler

texts.es: Tayler tiene 36 años; está casado, tiene 2 hijos y como cabeza de su hogar trata de brindar lo necesario a su familia, como la casa donde habitan que pudo adquirir con mucho esfuerzo. Su oficio de carpintero lo ejerce desde muy joven, pues la habilidad que tenía para trabajar con la madera lo motivó y lo llevó a dedicarse por completo a esa labor. Es así que desde hace 15 años viene trabajando en el pequeño taller que tiene en el patio de su casa, donde permanece todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche con el fin de terminar los pedidos de sus clientes. Tayler ama lo que realiza, por ello no encuentra pesadez al realizar su labor, lo único que a veces le impide seguir trabajando es la falta de materiales, pues tiene que parar y esperar el pago de los otros pedidos para atender los demás; es por ello que ansia tener grandes cantidades de materiales, así como las herramientas y maquinaria especializada para agilizar su trabajo. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinancieras PRISMA y espera continuar trabajando con el mismo esmero como hasta hoy, tratando siempre de que su banco comunal logre mayores ganancias en beneficio de todos sus compañeros y compañeras. Los 2000 soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de materiales para entregar prontamente los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Tayler is 36 years old. He is married and has two children. As head of the household, he tries to provide for his family's needs, like the house that he was able to acquire with very much effort. He has worked as a carpenter since he was very young. The skill that he had in woodworking motivated him to pursue this profession. For the past 15 years he has worked in a small workshop that he has in the patio of the house. He is there every day from 9am until the late hours of the night working to finish the orders of his clients.

Tayler loves his work, and for this reason he doesn't find it tiresome. The only thing that sometimes prevents him for continuing to work is lack of material. He must stop and wait for the payments of the other orders to attend to the rest of the orders. He therefore is anxious to to have large amounts of materials, such as tools and specialized machinery to speed up his work.

This is his ninth loan with Microfinancieras PRISMA and he hopes to continue working with the same care he has shown until today, always trying to help his communal bank increase earnings to benefit all of his fellow group members. He will invest the 2000 soles in buying materials to quickly deliver on pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying carpentry materials

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Ordzhonikidze city. Her monthly profit is 2,000 UAH.

Natalia has been in this business for four years. There is a high and constant demand for the items she sells. Natalia learned that to be successful she needs to a have large variety of items and good service. She feels this is something she can do well. Natalia has good relationships in her family and they support her in business.

Natalia would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to make an additional profit and spend it on current family needs.

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vanesa M. B., tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, él cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos una adolescente de doce años, que estudia y un niño de cuatro años de edad. Los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, para darle un mejor bienestar a los suyos, doña Karla trabaja en almacenes Tropigas, desde hace dos años, su salario no es lo suficiente para cubrir la construcción de sus vivienda, por lo cual necesita el apoyo de nuestra institución, para poder comprar poco a poco materiales para hacer efectiva dicha construcción. Y poder tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Karla Vanesa M. B. is 34 years old and she lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla area, located in the district of Ticuantepe, with her husband who helps her with the household costs. They look after their 2 kids, their daughter who is twelve years old and studying, and their four year old son. Their plans for the family are to improve their living conidtions. In order to give their kids better well-being Karla has been working in the Tropigas warehouses for two years. Her salary is not enough to cover the building of their house though, and this is why she needs help from our institution; to be able to buy the building materials needed for the construction bit by bit in order to have a decent home.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for their home/Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su vivienda

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Humberto G. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian
  Con dos créditos anteriores de FPV le ha hecho mejorar a su vivienda, pero le esta haciendo falta un cuarto. Tiene el proyecto de construirlo de buen material, para que la recama sea más segura y duradera. 
  El está solicitando un préstamo para la construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos de chofer de camión de carga. Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
  Cuando se realizo la visita la domicilio del solicitante el estaba en su trabajo quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Evangelina Martinez y un hijo de ellos.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto Galvan is a father whose two adolescent sons are currently studying. With previous credits from FPV he has been able to make some home improvements, but he still needs one more room. He plans to build it using good materials so that it is safer and longer lasting. He would like a loan for this construction and he plans to repay it with his earnings as a truck-load driver. His desire is for his kids to have their own room and to live better.

When the visit to Calos' house was carried out he was working and his wife, Evangelina Martinez, and one of their sons attended to us.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room at the front of the house/Construcción de una cuarto al frente de la casa

loans.name: Isidra Elsa

texts.es: La Señora Isidra Elsa Martínez tiene la edad de 69 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y bolsas de hielo. Hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, el comienzo de Isidra fue muy difícil porque tenia que cuidar a sus hijos que estaban pequeños y dedicarse a la elaboración de los refrescos naturales y bolsas de hielo, pero esto no desmotivo a Isidra para que saliera adelante, cada financiamiento otorgado por fundación león 2000 ha sido muy bien aprovechado para el beneficio de su negocio. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de gaseosas, refrescos naturales, bolsas de hielo y el pago de la energía eléctrica. Los deseos de Isidra son de mejorar su vivienda y que su negocio se convierta en el mejor.
texts.en:
Isidra Elsa M. is 69 years old and is a single mother. She looks after her two sons who are both studying. She sells cold drinks and bags of ice for a living. She started this business more than four years ago; in the beginning it was very difficult for Isidra because she had to look after her two sons, who were young then, and make natural drinks and bags of ice. This did not stop Isidra from moving forward, however, and she has made good use of each loan given to her by Fundacion Leon since 2000 for the benefit of her business. This is why she is asking for more working capital; to buy fizzy drinks, soft drinks and bags of ice and pay her electricity bills. Isidra's wishes are to improve her home and for her business to be the best.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital/capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Mercedes del Carmen  A. Pérez, tiene la edad de 20 años, habita en el barrio la borgoña, junto a sus padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y en futuro seguir estudiando para salir hacia delante y apoyar mas a sus padres, desde hace 5 años, esta joven se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas. Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
The young Mercedes del Carmen A. Pérez is 20 years old and she lives in the neighbourhood La Borgoña with her parents. She would like to improve her family's living conditions and in the future continue her studies so that she can move forward and support her parents more. For five years this young girl has been working in agriculture. Her biggest difficulty has been a lack of finances and a lot of pests. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and materials to apply to her crop in order to have a good harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizers to apply to her crops/Comprar insumos y fertilizante para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio D. tiene ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de tamales por las callas en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Está es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, a su negocio le esta haciendo falta un equipo mas moderno de sonido, para anunciar sus alimentos.
   Don Emilio D. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente, ahora esta solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder comprar el equipo que requiere, sin descapitalizar su ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Emilio D. has been selling tamales (a dish made mainly of tortilla dough and vegetables boiled in a banana leaf) on the streets of Nuevo Laredo for eight years. This is his family's source of income, but he needs some more modern sound equipment to announce his food.

Emilio D. has had two previous credits with FVP, both of which he has repaid punctually, and now he would like another one to be able to buy the sound system that he needs without having to take away from his family's income.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sound equipment for his work/Comprar de equipo para trabajar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Antonio C. es padre de familia y tiene un hijo para el cual quiere la seguridad.
      Con un crédito anterior que tenia en FVP pudo construir unos cuartos pero le está haciendo falta el techo, desea ponerlo de concreto para que sea más seguro y duradero. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
     Don Jesús Antonio trabaja en una maquiladora en el departamento de técnico, son los ingresos de su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el  crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio C. is the father of a family and has a son for whom he wants security. With the previous loan he had with FVP, he was able to construct a few rooms, but they are still missing a roof. He would like to make the roof out of concrete so that it is more secure and durable. However, he does not have enough money to be able to make these improvements as soon as possible. Jesús Antonio works in an assembly plant in the technical department, which provides the income for the family, a part of which will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: José Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor José Marcelo C. tiene ya mas de ocho años con su negocio de venta y elaboración de lonches y taco, es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
   Al negocio le está haciendo falta materia y algunas herramientas de trabajo, las que tiene actual mente están en muy mala condiciones. 
   Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para,  poder realizar la compara del material que necesita para realizar los alimentos y las herramientas necesarias, y su negocio estará mucho mejor y atenderá más rápido a su clientes.
texts.en:
José Marcelo C. has worked in the business of making and selling snacks and tacos for more than eight years. This is the source of income for the family. The business is in need of materials and some tools because the ones he currently has are in poor condition. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan, since at this time, he does not have enough money to be able to buy the materials or the necessary tools that he needs to make the foods. With this loan, his business will be much better and he will be able to assist his clients much faster.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and tools for work

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita es una mujer alegre y muy querida por sus vecinos, a sus 34 años vive sola en su propia casa y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) donde vende papa a las personas que concurren al mercado, quienes compran su producto debido a la variedad de tipos que ofrece. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo, es tener que lidiar con la tierra que traen las papas, puesto que se ensucia mucho al venderlas, aun así disfruta mucho de ofrecer su producto. Ya tiene 9 años en esta actividad, anhela ver crecer su negocio y que se convierta en el más grande del mercado, pues así podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cambiar su vida para bien. Es el primer préstamo de Benita con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos; en su banco comunal es muy participativa en las actividades del grupo. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en su negocio, podrá comprar más papa a sus proveedores y así incrementará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Benita is a happy woman and is very loved by her neighbors. She is 34 and lives in her own home. She really wants to get ahead. She has a small stand in Las Mercedes market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) where she sells potatoes to people who shop there. They buy her product due to the variety that she offers. The thing she likes the least about her job is dealing with the dirt on the potatoes. Her stand gets really dirty from selling them even though she enjoys selling them. She has had this business for 9 years. She hopes to grow her business and have it become the biggest in the market because she could increase her income and change her life for the better. This is the first loan that Benita has had with Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes to be very punctual with her payments because she would like to receive more loans. She participates a lot in the group activities of her communal bank. The 9,000 PEN she is requesting will be invested in her business. She will buy more potatoes from her providers and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda es una mujer de 40 años, sencilla y trabajadora; es madre de dos niños, Miguel de 12 y Rubén de 8 años. Actualmente vive en su casa propia hecha de adobe y desea salir adelante. En el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), tiene un pequeño lugar donde vende su deliciosa comida, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a las personas, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general acaba con todas las porciones preparadas. Tiene 15 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea implementar un restaurante para vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. A Imelda le gusta conversar con sus comensales, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto al mismo tiempo; pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este es su primer préstamo co MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo para no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetuosa con sus demás compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar la comida que vende y así podrá preparar más porciones al día.
texts.en:
Imelda is a 40 year old woman, unassuming and hardworking. She is the mother of 2 sons – Miguel, 12 years old, and Ruben who is 8. She lives in her own house which is made of adobe and she wants to get ahead. In the San Jose Market (the most important market of the city of Juliaca) she has a small space where she sells delicious food. The aroma that rises from her rich stews is enough to attract people. Her place is very busy and she usually runs out of all the prepared portions. She has been working for fifteen years in this business, which has provided the necessary money to feed her sons and pay for their studies, but she feels that in the future she is going to have more expenses and the money will not be enough. For this reason she wants to start a restaurant to sell her delicious dishes in a more comfortable setting and increase her income. Imelda likes to talk with her clients and enjoys doing that a lot, but it is difficult to attend to all the people that come to her place at the same time. However, she does not falter in her eagerness to move forward and is ready to work hard to achieve that. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be able to repay it on time so as to not create a problem for her community bank where she is very respectful of the other members. With the one thousand new soles she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients to prepare the meals she sells and be able to sell more portions each day,

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of meals the she sells

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia R. V. es una señora de 41 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, desde hace varios años doña Virginia inició un negocio de confección de ropa. Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.  Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas tales como: como cortinas, ropa de cama y toda clase de prendas de vestir, que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Virginia requiere un préstamo de ¢385,000 (trescientos ochenta y cinco  mil colones)  para comprar materiales tales como telas, hilos, encajes, entre otros, requeridos para confeccionar toda clase de prendas. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos. 

Doña Virginia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Virginia R. V., 41, lives with her husband and children in Las Delicias de Upala, a small, rural community in Costa Rica, which is located in the Alajuela province. This is where she engages in businesses like raising livestock for two reasons (meat and milk) and planting basic grains like rice, beans, corn, and others. Several years ago, due to the few sources of employment the community offers, Virginia started a business of making clothes. She did this to help her husband with the household expenses. She makes different types of things such as curtains, bedding, and all kinds of clothes. She later sells her work to businesses in her community and surrounding areas. Some people go to her house looking for her goods. Her small business has helped considerably to improve her family’s quality of life. She says that the success of her business is based upon being able to offer a good service to people and meeting their needs. Virginia currently needs a loan for ¢385,000 (three hundred eighty five thousand colones) to buy materials like fabric, thread, lace, among other things to make all types of items. Thanks to this loan she will be able to attract more customers, offer more choices, and considerably improve the quality of her products. Virginia is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, one of the one hundred organizations partnered with Edesa in Costa Rica. This is her third loan, and she hopes to keep growing on a personal and economic level. Thanks to these types of organizations and agencies facilitating loans, she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro O. tiene la edad de 42 años, es una mujer casada. La actividad económica es la venta de comida y golosinas. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio estableciendo su comida en su vivienda, pero la mayoría de sus clientes viven lejos, por lo que toma la decisión de ofrecer su comida a ciertos establecimientos ya que hay instituciones que le piden su comida, por lo que Mercedes es una mujer que responsable y luchadora con su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, papas y algunas golosinas. El sueño de Mercedes es mejorar los ingresos para su familia por lo que ayudaría a sufragar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
