Mercedes del Socorro O. is 42 and married. She sells food and sweets; she has been in this business for over 9 years. She started her business in her house, but most of her customers live far away. She then made the decision to offer her food at certain establishments. Some institutions request her food. Mercedes is a responsible woman who fights for her family. The loan is for working capital to buy basic grains, potatoes, and some sweets. Mercedes’ dream is to improve her income so that she can help defray the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Katy

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Katy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, vive en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguía  Nº 918 –, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza la motivó a crear su propio negocio de venta de mercería, se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y los precio bajos que oferta. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando con otros productos considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son sus amigos y vecinos del barrio donde vive. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 400.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como cuadros, portafotos, flores artificiales, artículos para regalos, accesorios como pulseras, anillos y collares. 

Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosa Katy belongs to the Las Nazarenas Community Bank. She lives at Jr. Augusto B. Leguía Nº 918 –,Bellavista district, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children. Her characteristic strength and perseverance motivated her to start her own notions business. She started with her first loan for 300 PEN. Day by day she was winning customers due to the good treatment and low prices she offers them. She continues with the same business, but she is expanding with other products based on customer demand. Her customers are mostly her friends and neighbors. With this loan for 400 PEN, she will buy stock such as pictures, photo holders, artificial flowers, gift items, and accessories like bracelets, rings and necklaces. She works with much optimism, and she appreciates the opportunity to have loans. The loans help her to develop as a woman and as small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy diverse products for her store (pictures, flowers, picture holders, bracelets, rings, necklaces)

loans.name: Mauricia Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Mauricia del Socorro R. Chavarría tiene 62 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que inicio con este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa, pero tenía muchas dificultades ya que no pasaba mucho tiempo con su familia. De manera que para estar más cerca de su familia y descansar un poco por lo que decide establecer esta pequeña pulpería que hasta los momentos es una fuente de empleos para ella y su hijo. Mauricia necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y leña. Sus deseos son de finalizar la construcción de su vivienda y también ampliar su negocio para que se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Señora Mauricia del Socorro R. Chavarría is sixty two years old and is a single mother. She has one son in her care. Her economic activity is a store. She started this business three years ago, and previously worked selling clothes, but had a lot of difficulty because she could spend much time with her family. So to be closer to her family and to rest for a little, she decided to establish this small store, that currently is a source of work for her and her son. Mauricia needs financing for working capital for the purchase of basic grains, delacicies, natural refreshments, bread and firewood. Her dream is to finalize the construction of her house and to expand her business to become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Nilda Flor

texts.es:
NILDA FLOR Z. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” en el distrito de Callería, tiene 31 años, 1 hijo, y su esposo trabaja en una constructora.

Tenía un negocio de venta de ropa y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 3 años, con él, compró algunas prendas de vestir. Ahora ella continua trabajando pero en el rubro de ventas de productos de belleza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y también en ropa para damas y caballeros que luego los mostrara en el pequeño local que tiene en su casa.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante,  gracias a ello puede ayudar a su esposo e hijo y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Nilda Flor Z. G. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" communal bank and lives in the district of Callería. She is 31 years old and has one son. Her husband works for a construction company. She had a business selling clothing and the first time that she obtained a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, 3 years ago, she used it to purchase clothing garments. She continues to work but now sells beauty products. With this loan of 1,700 Nuevos Soles she will invest in the purchase of beauty products, as well as men and women's clothing to display in the small store she has in her house. For the short time that she has been with the Manuela Ramos organization she feels happy with the help that it gives to women to help them get ahead; thanks to it she can help support her husband and son with the household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (cosmetics) as well as men and women's clothing

loans.name: Milton Jose

texts.es: Milton José Hernández M. tiene la edad de 23 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La  actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de molino anteriormente  el negocio lo empezó con el  molino, el cual era de muy mala calidad y era enfriado por agua al poco tiempo el motor se pego y decidió realizar un financiamiento para comprar otro motor por lo que este negocio le ofrecía muy buenas utilidades, por lo que así Milton deja a su esposa a cargo del molino y el recurría a diferentes lugares en busca de trabajo para generar mas ingresos y logro conseguir el trabajo distribuyendo pan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de un triciclo con motor ya que actualmente distribuye el pan en un triciclo sin motor y tiene que atravesar lugares muy lejanos. El sueño de Milton es establecer su propia panadería porque le gusta este tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Milton José Hernández M. is 23 years old, married with 2 children. His work is offering milling services. He started the business with a mill that was low quality and had to be cooled with water. A short time ago the motor failed and he decided to use a loan to purchase another motor and thus the business is now generating good income. He left this work for his wife and was in search of other work to make more money and managed to find work distributing bread. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase a motorized cart since his current cart doesn't have a motor and he has to go to places that are far away. Milton's dream is to establish his own bakery since he likes this type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia Petrona

texts.es: Julia Petrona M. tiene la edad de 40 años, es una madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace mas de 5 que se dedica a este negocio, pero importante resaltar que es un negocio ambulante, que nació con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia y así ayudar a su esposo para que juntos su familia salga adelante, la metodología que Julia utiliza es brindar los productos de cosméticos a personas que trabajan en instituciones, colegios, tiendas entre otros. Julia tiene como sueño mantener su negocio y lograr obtener más recursos para invertir su inventario y también proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar decente donde vivir el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Julia Petrona M. is 40 years old and she is a single Mom. She has 4 children in her care. She runs a business selling general merchandise. She has been running this business for more than 5 years and it is important to note that she carries out her business from door to door. She started out with the goal of covering the family's expenses and to help her husband so that together the family will be taken care of. Julia brings cosmetic products to customers in companies, schools, and stores etc. Julia's dream is to keep up her business and to have greater resources to invest in her inventory. She also dreams to making improvements to her home so that her children will have a decent place to live in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Magaly Briceño M.  tiene 39 años, vive en la calle San Lucas Nº 702 del distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijas que depende económicamente de ella.
Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace 15 días, inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa por un lapso de 2 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de polos, casacas, pantalones.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas para implementar su bodega.
Julia tiene como sueño tener su minimarket  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Julia Magaly Briceño M. is 39 and lives in the Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo in the deparment of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through secondary school and has 2 daughters who depend on her economically. Julia has sold groceries for 2 weeks. She started her business of selling clothing 2 years ago and has her business in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from the communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza II", she will purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to supply her store. Julia has a dream of having a mini-market to grow her microbusiness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Luz R. B.  tiene 34 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Hilda se dedica a la venta de bisutería y venta de productos de belleza hace 4 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa y sale a vender al mercado.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de hilos, piedritas, herramientas.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como peluches, hilos, alambres, piedras  para implementar negocio.
Hilda tiene como sueño tener su puesto en el mercado  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda Luz R. B. is 34 and lives in the Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through secondary school and has 3 children who depend on her economically. Hilda has sold imitation jewelry and beauty products for 4 years. She develops her business in her home and sells in the market. With her first credit of 300 PEN that she received from her communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza II", she invested in the purchase of thread, wire, stones, and tools. She will invest this credit of 1500 PEN in the purchase of felt, thread, wire, and stones to supply her business. Hilda's dream is to have a stand in the market to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase felt, thread, wire, and stones to supply her business

loans.name: Henry Jose

texts.es: Henry José Gonzáles M. tiene la edad de 27 años. Es un hombre casado. Y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Y pesar que ha pasado por mucho no ha perdido las ganas de salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada y tortillas. Hace mas de 3 años que inicio este negocio, comenzó con la ayuda de su esposa ya que ella elaboraba las tortillas y el recorría  las calles a venderlas y los fines de semana se encarga de ofrecer la ropa usada a sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes. Henry es un hombre responsable por lo que para el es muy importante llevar el sustento diario para su familia. Los financiamientos han sido de buena ayuda pues todos han sido muy bien aprovechados. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para invertirlo en su negocio y así comprar leña, maíz y ropa. Los sueños de Henry son de seguir manteniendo esta única fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Henry José Gonzáles M. is 27, married, and raising two children. In spite of the fact that he has been through a lot, he has not lost the desire to get ahead. He sells used clothes and tortillas. He started his business over three years ago. He started with his wife’s help. She makes the tortillas, and he travels the streets selling them. On the week ends he sells used clothes to his friends, neighbors, and some customers. Henry is a responsible man, and it is very important to him to provide his family with their daily bread. The loans have been a good help, and he has used them very well. The loan he is asking for is to buy wood, corn, and clothes. Henry’s dream is to maintain this sole source of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Delicia

texts.es:
La señora María Delicia B. D. R.  tiene 63 años, vive en la calle San Pablo Nº 620 del distrito D. la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria  Incompleta, no tiene  hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
María se dedica a la elaboración D. vestidos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa y sale a vender al mercado.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra D. hilos, telas para elaborar los enagües.
El crédito D. 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos como hilos, telas para elaborar vestidos para niñas.
María tiene como sueño tener su tienda D. ropa para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
María Delicia B. D. R. is 63 years old and lives at 620 San Pablo Street in the lower part of the district of Esperanza in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She did not finish elementary school and does not have children that depend on her financially. María dedicates herself to making dresses in her home, and she goes out to sell them in the market. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she invested in buying threads and fabrics to make the dresses. She will invest this loan of 500 soles in purchasing products such as threads and fabrics to make dresses for little girls. María's dream is to have her own clothing store and to grow her microenterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products such as threads and fabrics to make dresses for girls

loans.name: Nereida Elena

texts.es:
La señora Nereida Elena M. D. Briceño tiene 63 años, vive en el distrito D. la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria  Incompleta, no tiene  hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Nereida se dedica a la venta D. productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas, cerveza  en su bodega, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa 
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra D. productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas, cerveza.
El crédito D. 600 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas, cerveza  para implementar su negocio.
Nereida tiene como sueño tener su minimarket para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Nereida Elena M. D. Briceño, 63, lives in the lower part of the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She did not finish elementary school, and she has no children who are economically dependent upon her. Nereida sells products like rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, soft drinks, and beer. She sells from her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN that she received from her Community Bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she bough products like rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, soft drinks and beer. She will use this loan for 600 PEN to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, soft drinks and beer to establish her business. Nereida’s dream is to have a mini market in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, soft drinks, and beer in order to establish her business

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio tiene años 55 años, vive sólo con su esposa, ya que sus hijos son independientes. Desde hace 5 años que se viene dedicando a la venta de zapatos, iniciándose en este negocio motivado por un amigo que se dedicaba a viajar a otras ciudades y traer los zapatos para distribuir en los mercados de su localidad. Entonces Artemio se animó a trabajar así, resultándole un negocio muy rentable; pero no todo resulto bien, ya que este socio, pasado un tiempo, lo defraudó llevándose gran parte de las ganancias. Artemio no se amilanó y siguió adelante, convirtiéndose ahora en un próspero comerciante de zapatos, lo cual le gusta mucho y ha adquirido mucha experiencia, además su poder de convencimiento logra que la clientela sea muy asidua a su puesto. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y espera pronto tener una gran tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad, puesto que vender a la intemperie ocasiona que sus zapatos se empolven y no se vean atractivos. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está muy contento con su grupo, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy amigables y divertidas, pero sobre todo muy puntuales con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado planea viajar a la ciudad de Trujillo, conocida por elaboración de zapatos novedosos y de muy buena calidad, abasteciéndose de una gran cantidad para incrementar el stock de su puesto.
texts.en:
Artemio is 55 years old, and lives alone with his wife, now that his children are independent. For 5 years he has been dedicated to the sale of shoes, motivated to initiate this business by a friend who used to travel to other cities and bring back shoes to distribute in the markets in their area. So, Artemio fancied working like this, resulting in a very profitable business. But, everything didn't work out well, as this associate, a while ago, defrauded him, taking a large part of the profits. Artemio wasn't daunted by this and continued moving forward, converting it into a prosperous shoe business, which he likes very much and has acquired much experience in, and also with his conviction has been able to attract an asiduous clientele to his stand. His wish is to grow his business and he hopes to soon have a large shop where he can sell with greater comfort, as his stand where he sells now, when there is occasional bad weather, means his shoes become powdery and don't look attractive. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and now he is very content with his group, as all his companions are very friendly and fun, but above all, very punctual with their payments. With the money he is soliciting he plans to travel to the city of Trujillo, known for its innovative and excellent quality shoe production, supplying himself with a large quantity to increase the stock of his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marina Deysi

texts.es:
La señora Marina Deysi B. Beltrán tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria  Completa, no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Marina se dedica a la venta de plantas domestica, macetas y abono, su negocio lo desarrolla en el mercado COMIMAR.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como plantas, macetas y abono.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como plantas, macetas y abono  para implementar su negocio.
Marina tiene como sueño tener su Negocio más surtido para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The señora Marina Deysi B. Beltrán is 58 years old, and lives in the district of Esperanza parte Baja, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finish primary school, and doesn't have children that depend on her economically. Marina sells domestic plants, flowerpots and fertiliser, and her business is developed in the market COMIMAR. With her first loan of 300 soles she received form her communal bank Nueva Esperanza II, she invested in the purchase of products like plants, flowerpots and fertiliser. The loan of 500 soles she will invest in the purchase of plants, flowerpots and fertiliser to set up her business. Maria's dream is to have her business well-stocked so she can grow as a micro businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of plants, flowerpots and fertiliser to set up her business

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es: Estanislao tiene 37 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa Nilda de 41 años y sus dos hijas de 12 y 14 años. Desde hace 18 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (taxi), puesto que muy joven aprendió a conducir en diferentes vehículos de amigos y familiares. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da la libertad de movilizarse y no estar en un solo lugar como la mayoría de los otros negocios, pero no todo es bueno, puesto que su labor es muy cansada, ya que trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, descansando sólo para almorzar y cenar. Estanislao se siente feliz de progresar, sabe que lo irá haciendo poco a poco con ayuda de toda su familia; felizmente sus ingresos son buenos, ya que tiene gran cantidad de clientes y para el futuro espera seguir adquiriendo más autos para tener una flota de taxis. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, promete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos, actuando con la responsabilidad que siempre lo ha caracterizado. Con el dinero solicitado quiere arreglar algunos desperfectos de su auto para brindar un mejor servicio y también le hará un cambio de aceite.
texts.en:
Estanislao is 37 years old, and lives in his own home with his wife Nilda, 41, and their 2 daughters, 12 and 14. For 18 years he has worked transporting passengers (taxi), and learned very young to drive different cars belonging to friends and family. He likes his job a lot, because it gives him freedom to move and not be in only one place like many other businesses. But not everything is good, as his labour is very tiring, as he works from 8 in the morning until 10 at night, resting only to have lunch and dinner. Estanislao feels happy with his progress, as he knows that he will make it little by little with the help of his entire family. Happily his profits are good, now that he has a large quantity of clients, and in the future he hopes to contiue acquiring more cars to have a fleet of taxis. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he promises to be very punctual with all his payments, displaying the responsbility that has always characterised him. With the money he is soliciting he wants to fix several imperfections in his car and change the oil, to offer a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Veronica Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Verónica Roxana Briceño M. tiene 29 años, vive en el Consejo Menor El Milagro III Sector, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria  Completa,  tiene  2 hijas que depende económicamente de ella.
Verónica se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos y pollos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como pollos y patos, la comida para criarlos.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como pollos y patos, la comida para criarlos para implementar su negocio.
Verónica tiene como sueño tener su granja para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Verónica Roxana Briceño M. is 29 and lives in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied through secondary school and has 2 daughters who depend on her economically. Verónica raises and sells small animals like ducks and chickens. She has her business at her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from the communal bank Nueva Esperanza II, she bought products like chickens and ducks and food to feed them. With this credit of 500 PEN, she will purchase the same products to supply her business. Verónica's dream is to have a farm to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products like chickens and ducks and food for them to supply her business

loans.name: Guid

texts.es: Guid tiene 49 años, vive con su hija de 8 años y su esposa, quien trabaja preparando y vendiendo comida. Desde muy joven se sintió atraído por el manejo de automóviles, es así que cuando se le dio la oportunidad de asociarse con un grupo de amigos y brindar servicio de taxi, no lo pensó dos veces y decidió arriesgarse. Felizmente todo le ha ido muy bien y ahora tienen 5 autos trabajando para ellos, en uno de los cuales él mismo trabaja. Comienza a las 9 de la mañana y termina a las 9 ó 10 de la noche para lograr los ingresos necesarios, su meta es obtener 100 soles diarios y trabaja hasta reunirlos. Asimismo, debe hacer el mantenimiento de su carro cada 15 días, donde gasta gran parte de sus ganancias. Guid es muy trabajador y quiere seguir progresando, es por ello que en para el futuro le gustaría tener una gran flota de taxis y convertirse en un empresario del transporte. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su auto, además de tramitar algunas licencias que se han vencido.
texts.en:
Guid is 49 years old and lives with his 8-year old daughter and his wife, who works preparing and selling food. Since he was very young, he felt attracted to driving cars. This is why when he was given the opportunity to associate with a group of friends and offer taxi services, he didn't think twice and decided to take the risk. Happily, everything went well and now they have five taxis, of which he drives one. He starts work at 9 in the morning and ends work at 9 or 10 at night in order to attain the salary he needs. His aim is to obtain 100 soles daily and he works until he earns that amount. At the same time, he needs to perform maintenance on his car every 15 days, which is where he spends a great part of his earnings. Guid is very hard-working and wants to continue progressing. For that reason, he would like to own a fleet of taxis and become a taxi businessman. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and he promises to be very punctual in his payments. With the money he is requesting, he will fix his car and take care of expired licenses.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo, su hija de 15 y su hijo de 12 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de café, distribuyendo esta bebida a los comerciantes del mercado Belaúnde de su localidad. Aprovechando que la temperatura está bajando debido a la cercanía del invierno, el consumo de bebidas calientes es muy requerido por las personas. Por ello, Margarita se levanta muy temprano y vende sus vasos de café acompañados de sándwich a los trabajadores que empiezan su jornada diaria cerca del mercado, regresa antes del medio día para realizar sus labores en casa y por las tardes vuelve a salir a vender. Margarita se encuentra muy contenta, ya que su negocio es rentable porque prepara las cantidades necesarias para los pedidos que le hacen sus “caseritos” (fieles clientes) como ella los llama, además sabe que de seguir mejorando su rentabilidad, en un futuro podrá alquilar un local para vender con mayor comodidad su café. Este es su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está muy contenta con su banco comunal puesto que entre todos los miembros son amigos, además de ser puntuales en sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará otra cafetera y vasos descartables. Además, Margarita quiere invertir en otro negocio, que muy posiblemente sea la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 38-years old and lives with her husband, her 15-year old daughter and 12-year old son in a house that the family owns. For two years she has worked preparing and selling coffee to the merchants at Belaúnde market in her town. She is taking advantage of the low temperatures, due to the approaching winter, which increases the demand for hot drinks. Thus, Margarita gets up very early and sells coffee and sandwich to the workers who begin their work day close to the market. She then returns home before noon to do house work and goes back to the market in the afternoon to continue selling. Margarita is very happy, as her business is profitable because she prepares just the right quantity to meet the needs of her "caseritos" (loyal customers). Also, she knows that to continue improving her profits, in the future she will need to rent a location to sell greater quantities. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is very happy with her community bank, as the members are friends, and also very punctual with their loan payments. With the requested loan she will buy a coffee maker and disposable cups. Also, Margarita wants to invest in another business, possibly one selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee maker and investment in another business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He sells various small home products at the central market in Vinogradovo City. He has been in this business for five years and his monthly profit is about 4,000 UAH. 

Alexander's kiosk is located at the entrance to the market. This gives him a great advantage in sales. He says that small sales items that are not expensive are always in high demand and bring a stable profit.

Alexander is entrepreneurial and a hard working person. His business goal is to open a second location, where his wife can sell similar products and make this business really a family business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
Clemente M. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 49 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Clemente operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Clemente has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Clemente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemente is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Clemente from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel A. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 30 years old and married with five school-age children. To make a living, Romel operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Romel has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Romel from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Carmenda

texts.en:
Carmenda M., from the village of Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, is 39 years old and single. To make a living, Carmenda owns and operates a sewing business, providing clothing repairs to local community members. She has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carmenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fabrics and materials. Carmenda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials for sewing. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials for sewing

location.town: Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Eva is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Eva operates a business weaving and selling nipa (palm) products to local businesses and community members. Eva is just starting this business.

In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offering. Eva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials like nipa leaves to weave in order to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Eva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

texts.en: Mrs. Ludina E., 31 years old, has one dependent and resides in Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her existing business is "kapping" (used for dried fish) and her other source of income is buying and selling charcoal. Both husband and wife, together, manage their business. They started their business with small capital and they have managed to expand it. But, due to a financial crisis from which their family is suffering right now, they cannot meet the demands of their customers. Mrs. Ludina E. has decided to take a loan from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in the amount of PHP 15,000. This loan will be used for additional capital in the business. It will not only help to meet the demands of their customers but will also help the business to become more progressive in the future.  This will also help them meet their family’s needs for everyday survival.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative):

PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jethro

texts.en: Paglaum MPC was created to give programs and services to those who are in need of financial assistance and to provide training with regard to business. Jethro O. became a member of Paglaum in July of 2008. Jethro lacked financial capital for his sari-sari store. (The word sari-sari is Tagalog for "various kinds".)  Jethro had only enough money to build the variety store. He is requesting PHP 20,000 to buy additional goods for sale. He is thankful that he now has income for his family. In the future, Jethro hopes to expand his business to a mini-grocery store and for his family to have a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif was born in 1969. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Khodjali region, and is now settled in Baku city. He is married and has three children. Six years ago he decided to start a business selling juices. Now he needs a loan of 1300 AZN to buy more juice for expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy juices to sell

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en: Matanat is a teacher at school. Five years ago she started a home tutoring business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a computer for improving her business. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar town, settled in Khirdalan town. Matanat is married, has two children, and was born in 1969.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
You can see Shakhla's father in this picture. Shakhla is applying to Kiva for her second loan. She received her first loan from Kiva in 2007. Her father transports goods and she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the spare parts to improve her father's business.

She says, "Thanks!"

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
This young man received his first loan from Kiva in 2007 and improved his business. He works in currency exchange and he did not change his business. Azer says, "I like my business. This business is very interesting." 

He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy equipment necessary for improving his business. He says, "Hi Kiva lenders. Thank you very much for the loan."

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for improving his business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two children. She sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city. She has been in this business for twelve years. She has always tried to offer her clients a large variety at affordable prices. The clothing business is the only source of income for this family. Tatiyana uses the profit to help her, her husband, and parents to survive economically.

Tatyana would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase her inventory of clothing for the season. She would like to continue to develop this business to provide for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of men's clothing.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina H. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business by purchasing more charcoal. Paulina is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. They have two children, who are both attending school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Abau

texts.en:
Abau L. sells various types of goods at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more items to sell. Abau is 36 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent at Jebel kujur.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her shop.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Хикматов Алишер проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 24 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Алишер имеет торговую точку на рынке. Он более 10 лет торгует материалами. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент для продажи.
texts.en:
Alisher H. lives in the Gissar district. He is 24 years old, married and has 2 children. Alisher has a retail stand at a market. He has been selling fabrics for over 10 years. Our client is requesting a loan in order to buy new good assortment for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new goods assortment

loans.name: Hukmiddin

texts.ru: Хукмиддин Саидов женат, детей не имеет. Проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 25 лет. Хукмиддин имеет торговую точку на рынке "Мубориз", он торгует материалами. Этим видом деятельности занимаетя более 8 лет. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Hukmiddin S. is 25 years old, married and has no children. He lives in the Gissar district. Hukmiddin has a retail stand at the Muboriz market, where he sells fabrics. He has been involved in this business for over 8 years. Our client is requesting a loan in order to increase his good turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kapuki

texts.en: Kapuki S. is currently in the business of selling beer at her home and is requesting a loan to open a bar. Kapuki is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a security guard. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry (truck) to carry crates of beer from the producers to her bar. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ерова Ибодат в возрасте 42 года, проживает в районе Гиссара. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Сама клиентка  имеет свою столовую на центральном рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 7 лет. Ей также в этом помогают ее дети. Ибодат просит кредит, чтобы закупить продукты питания для столовой.
texts.en:
Ibodat E. is 42 years, married and has 3 children. She lives in the Gissar district. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Our client owns a café at the central market. She has been involved in this business for over 7 years. Her children also help her with the business. Ibodat is requesting this loan in order to purchase food products for the café.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Konga

texts.en: Konga R. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Konga is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a security guard. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Sohibchamol

texts.ru: Сохибчамол Гулматова проживает в районе гиссра. Возраст 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Сохибчамол имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке, где торгует растительным маслом. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 15 лет. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Sohibchamol G. lives in the Gissar district. She is 48 years, married and has 2 children. Sohibchamol has a retail stand at the central market, where she sells vegetable oil. She has been involved in this business for over 15 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase her product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Kape

texts.en: Kape E. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. Kape is 45 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.ru: Салохиддин Саидов проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Салохиддин более 6 лет занимается услугой такси. До этого он работал по своей специальности 5 лет "товароведом". Жена по специальности работает доктором в местной поликлинике. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы установить газовое оборудывание, т.к. газовое топливо дешевле.
texts.en:
Salohiddin S. lives in the Gissar district. He is 37 years old, married and has 2 children. Salohiddin has been working as a taxi driver for over 6 years. Previously, he worked as a commodity buyer for 5 years. His wife is a doctor at the local hospital. Our client is requesting this loan in order to install gas equipment for his vehicle because gas fuel is cheaper.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of gas equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en: John V. is currently in the business of selling maize at the market and is requesting a loan to open a shop. John is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Alberto José González , tiene la edad de 48 años, habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya , junto a su esposa , ella le apoya en los trabajos agrícolas y tres veces por semana vende en el mercado ; ellos tiene siete hijos , ya todos casado e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Alberto desde hace cinco años , se dedica al trabajo de campo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y en ocasiones se ha visto afectado por la sequilla .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha y pueda vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto José González is 48 years old and lives with his wife in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood of Masaya. His wife helps him with his agricultural work and goes to the market three times a week to sell their products. They have seven adult children who are all married. Mr. Alberto would like to improve living conditions for his family. He has been farming for five years and finds that the most difficult part is lack of money. He has also had some problems with drought. He will buy fertilizers and supplies with the loan money to put on his crops so he will get a good harvest and be able to sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar al cultivo

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa de Jesús C. Vicente, tiene la edad de 36 años, habita en el barrio Denis Larios, junto a su esposo, el cual  le apoya con los gastos de hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos , una de doce años y un niño de ocho añitos , los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre a sus hijos , doña Teresa desde hace dos años, se dedica a trabajos agrícolas , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su esposo , los planes futuro para su cultivo es poder plantar mas frutas y venderla a un mejor precio .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y obtener una mejor cosecha. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo otorgado para hacer mejoras a sus cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa de Jesús C. Vicente is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the Denis Larios neighborhood. She helps her husband meet the household expenses. They have two children to take care of: a girl who is 12 years old and a boy who is 8 years old. Both are in school. Mrs. Teresa’s plans are to improve her family’s living conditions and support her children. She has been working in agriculture for two years. Teresa started this job with her husband’s help. She plans to plant more fruits in the future and sell them at a better price. With this loan money, she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops so she can improve her harvest. She thanks the institution for its support in helping her improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar inzumos y fertilizantes para abonar al cultivo

loans.name: Margarito Antonio

texts.es: El señor Margarito Antonio C. , tiene la edad de 49 años , habita en el barrio La Borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , ya todos casado , pero el le apoya a una hija de 18 que es madre soltera , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 31 años don Margarito trabaja en la a agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo por falta de fertilizantes ,el inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios , los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el financiamiento va a compara fertilizantes e insumos, para tener una buena producción y mejor venta en el mercado. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los crédito con a plazos accesible, esto ha sido de mucho beneficio para su familia ya que han podido mantener el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito Antonio C. is 49 years old and lives with his wife, who helps him with the household expenses. They live in the La Borgoña neighborhood of Ticuatepe and have three children who are all married. He helps support one of his daughters who is an 18-year-old single mother. Mr. Margarito would like to help improve his family’s living conditions. Mr. Margarito has been working in agriculture for 31 years. He got into this business through his own efforts. In Mr. Margarito's opinion, the pests that invade his crops because there is not enough fertilizer, is the most difficult part of farming. In the future he plans to diversify his crops. With this loan, he will buy fertilizer and supplies so he can have a good yield and therefore get better prices in the market. He thanks Afodenic for supporting him with a loan that’s affordable. This has been very helpful for his family since they have been able to maintain their crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Animata's Group

texts.en:
This is Animata L., Lucy C. and Elizabeth J.. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. 

However, they had received previous loans from FAWE (Forum for African Women Education). Those loans have created significant impacts into the lives of these women. Aminata for example was able to pay her child’s college fee because of those loans.  Now, with the introduction of SMT, a Partner of Shine On Sierra Leone in Waterloo and the closure of the FAWE micro-loan scheme, these women have come to SMT/Shine On Sierra Leone for a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enabled them expand their businesses. 

Animata L. (right) is the leader of this group. Animata is 55 years of age. She was born in Songo village, about 32 miles from Freetown. She is a widow with five children. Three of her children are already grown-ups and two are still in the university. Animata sells cold water and cooked rice within the neighborhood. Animata has been a businesswoman for four years now. With this loan, she will be able to enlarge her business by buying cooking ingredients at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients at wholesale

loans.name: Help We Sef Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata J., Oya T., Isatu J. and Sallay T.. They named their group Help We Sef. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty mile from Freetown. This is their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses.

Fatmata (right) is the leader of the group. She is 35 years of age. She was born in Bumpeh-Rotufunk. She is married to a teacher and the two have six children. Three of their children are already grown-ups, one is in secondary school and the rest are in primary schools. She has been a businesswoman for over 20 years now. Fatmata sells market food – onions, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi, tomatoes and so on. So far, Fatmata faces no serious challenges in her business that are worth noting. Business is going fine and well. She enjoys what she does for a living.

loans.use: Expand food market business

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es: El señor Santos Roberto Busto, tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio San Juan, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos uno de 22 años ya es casado, el de 19 estudia y le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas y una adolescente de doce años que estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , desde hace 33 años don Roberto se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que le afectan al cultivo , el inicio esta actividad por si solo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversificar su cultivo . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder sacar una buena producción  y vender a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Roberto Busto is 45 years old and lives with his wife, who helps him with the household expenses, in the San Juan neighborhood. They have three children. One is 22 years old and already married and one is a 19-year-old student who helps with the farm work. They also have a 12 year old who is a student. Mr. Santos would like to improve his family’s living conditions. Mr. Santos has worked in agriculture for 33 years and finds pests and lack of money to be the hardest parts. He got into this business by his own efforts. In the future, he plans to diversify his crops. With the loan money, he will buy fertilizer and supplies so he can get a good harvest and sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor José Reynaldo S. Meléndez, tiene la edad de 61 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos, todos mayor de edad independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace cinco años don Reynaldo trabaja como chofer, su sueños es poder terminar de construir su casa, ya que el necesita un financiamiento para poder realizar sus sueños.  Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de concreto y poder tener mejor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
José Reynaldo S. Meléndez is 61 years old. He lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood with his wife, who helps him cover living expenses. They have three children, all of them adults. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions. Don Reynaldo has been working as a driver for five years. He hopes to finish building his house, and needs financing to be able to make that dream come true. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials for the concrete walls and make his family more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for concrete walls

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
This is Abass M. B., Abdulai F., Alhaji O. J., Abdul K. and Idrissa K.. The named their group Together As One. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. They are thus requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to do so.


Abass M. B. (left) is the leader of this group. Abass is 23 years of age. He was born in Waterloo small-town, twenty miles from Freetown. Abass is happily married with one child who is still a baby. He sells a variety of items: tape recorders, radios, mobile phone accessories and much more. He has been a businessman for three years now.  With this loan, he will be able to expand his business so that his profit margin will increase.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie K., age 50. Marie sells foodstuffs like rice, cooking oil, onions, flour, sugar and many more. She has been in business for many years now. This will be her very first loan from SMT.

Marie was born in Koya Rural District, which is 24 miles from Freetown. She currently resides in Waterloo where she runs her business. She is married. Her husband is retired and the couple have four children. Three are adults and one has just written the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Exams (WASSE).

Marie is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help strengthen her business. With this loan from SMT/Kiva, Marie is expecting a vast improvement in her business and an incremental increase in the amount of profit she makes. The profit will be reinvested into the business and some will be saved for future use. The remainder will be used to assist her husband in providing food for their household.

loans.use: To invest in food market business

loans.name: Kamalaneh Group

texts.en:
These ladies--Mary M. K., Kadiatu S. and Patricia E. S.--are local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo. They've named their group Kamaleneh. They have been in business for several years now but their businesses have been growing at a very slow pace. With the arrival of SMT (Salone Microfinance Trust) in Waterloo a few months ago, they have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 each, in order to boost their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to increase their inventory, make more profit, assist their school-going children, and meet most of their daily financial challenges.

Mary M. K. (right) is the leader of this group. Mary is 39 years of age. She was born in Lunar, northern Sierra Leone, but now resides in Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. Her husband is a businessman and they have three children together. One of their children is in college, another is in secondary school and the last is in primary school.

Mary sells gari (fast food made by grinding cassava), palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and wheat. She has been a businesswoman for over ten years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy goods in large quantity, make more profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in food market business

loans.name: Guillermo Nicanor

texts.es: El señor Guillermo A. tiene la edad de 57 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado y sus hijos son mayores de edad, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer mejoras a su casa, el trabaja vendiendo leña y metales reciclables ya son veinte años de experiencia, el cual inicio con fondos propios para llevar día a día la alimentación a su casa. Por falta de capital no ha podido crecer, pero ha podido estar estable con prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado para poder hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este préstamo es el sexto ciclo el en que invertirá en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer aumento a un cuarto y cambiar una hojas de zinc que tiene en mal estado, y poder estar en buenas condiciones con su familia. Su objetivo es incrementar el volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Señor Guillermo A. is 57 years of age and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of the capital of Managua. He is married and his two children are adults. His plans are to be able to finish making improvements to his house. He works selling firewood and recycling metal. He has 20 years experience at this which he began doing to keep food on the table in his house. His business hasn't grown due to a lack of capital, but it has been stable with loans that AFODENIC has approved so that he can make improvements to his home. This is his sixth loan cycle and it will be used to buy construction materials to build an addition to a room, to replace some galvanized roof panels that have deteriorated and to make things nicer for his family. His objective is to increase his sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

texts.es: Doña Aura Elena tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio el Recreo en la ciudad de Managua, sus hijos son mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de granos básicos, frutas, verduras y productos lácteos desde hace diez años, inicio trabajando en una empresa de afanadora, ahorro y trabaja por cuenta propia en su pequeña pulpería, con este crédito va  a comprar granos básicos, productos enlatados y lácteos para ofertar  a sus clientes una variedad de productos. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo que ha tenido mediante plazos favorables para crecer en su negocio. Sus planes a corto plazo es hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Aura Elena is a 55-year-old woman who lives in the Recreo neighborhood in the city of Managua. Her children are all adults now. She has been selling staple grains, fruits, vegetables, and dairy products for ten years. Initially, she worked as a cleaning lady in a company, but she saved up some money and now has her own general store. With this loan, she will purchase staple grains, canned goods, and dairy products to offer her customers a variety of products. She gives thanks to the institute for the support that she has received via favorable installments so that she can help her business grow. Her short-term goal is to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Pablo Absalon

texts.es: El señor Pablo Absolon de 62 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposa le dio tres hijos todos mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de golosinas, atol, arroz de leche y cereales, el cual vende desde hace trece años, estas ventas las inicio con fondos propios y ayuda de sus hijos, el vende ambulante en un mercado el Mayoreo en la capital, con este solicitud va invertir en la compra de una carreta, frutas y verduras, para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que con sus créditos a logrado este es su onceavo crédito y se ha beneficiado en su negocio como en su vida personal en el sustento de su familia. Sus planes es poder Terminal de hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Absalon is a married 62-year-old man who lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have three grown children. He sells candy, atol (a cornstarch-based hot drink), rice pudding, and grains as a street vendor in a wholesale market in the capital. He will invest this loan in a cart, fruits, and vegetables so that he can keep expanding his business. He gives thanks to Afodenic for its support in the form of loans. This is his eleventh loan, and he has benefited from these loans not only in his business, but also in his personal life in supporting his family. He plans on finishing his home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cart, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Esmelda Maria-

texts.es: La señora Esmelda Maria Benavides,  de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad, los dos estudian,  su esposo labora como cadete de taxi, y ella vende mariscos desde hace cinco años, anteriormente vendía en su casa refrescos pero luego inicio la venta de mariscos rico en comida, y es un producto rentable. Con este crédito es su noveno ciclo que va invertir en la compra de mariscos variados como: camarones, conchas, pescado, ostiones para hacer sus ricos cócteles que son comprados por muchos nicaragüenses. Sus planes es mejorar el tramo donde vende para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Esmelda Maria Benavides is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children ages 8 and 14. Her husband is a taxi cab driver, while she has been selling seafood for five years. She used to sell beverages, but she then started a seafood business because it is more lucrative. This is her ninth loan that she will invest in purchasing various types of seafood, such as: shrimp, clams, fish, and oysters to make her delicious seafood cocktails that many Nicaraguans love to purchase. Her plan is to improve her stall so that she can offer better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shrimp, clams, etc.

loans.name: Nicolasa Carolina

texts.es: La señora Incolaza Carolina L. de 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Anexo Villa Reconciliación, casada y con seis hijos de 7, 11, 14, 17,19 y 22 años de edad, todos estudian, su esposo es fotógrafo profesional. Sus planes para su familia es poder  seguir mejorando su vivienda ya que es muy insegura por que es de zinc y lo que más desea es un techo digno. Su negocio es la venta de tortilla que hace desde hace dieciséis años con dinero que su esposo dio. La tortilla es el alimento de todos los nicaragüenses y vende mucho, al público como  en los restaurantes. Con este crédito es su séptimo el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir un muro y cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado. A futuro es seguir mejorando  la infraestructura de su casa para lograr una casa digna.
texts.en:
Señora Incolaza Carolina L. is 42 years of age and lives in the Anexo Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She is married and has six children, ages 7, 11, 14, 17, 19 and 22, and all of them are in school. Her husband is a professional photographer. Her plans for her family are to be able to continue improving her home. It is very insecure because it is made of galvanized sheet metal and what she really wants is a decent roof. Her business is selling tortillas which she started doing 16 years ago with some money that her husband gave her. The tortilla is the food of all Nicaraguans and she sells a lot of them, to the public as well as to restaurants. This will be her seventh loan which she will use to buy construction materials to build a wall and to change the roof of her house which is in a bad way. After that she will continue improving the infrastructure so she can have a decent house. Click here to view her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa D. est née le 31/12/1960 à Nyigbé, mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a pour activité principale, la fabrication et vente de beignets devant sa maison d’habitation. Actuellement la demande dépasse largement l’offre, mais elle n’a pas les moyens nécessaires. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour s’approvisionner en farine et huile afin de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux charges de sa famille et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa D. was born on 31 December, 1960 in Nyigbé. She is married and has three children. As her main business, she prepares and sells fritters in front of her house. Currently, demand has greatly surpassed her supply, but she does not have the means necessary to meet this demand. She is thus seeking a loan to supply herself with flour and oil in order to respond effectively to the needs of her clientele. The income drawn from her business will allow her to provide for her family and improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell fritters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Née en 1960, Mme Ami Z. est marié et a en charge sept (07) personnes. Elle a pour activité principale l’achat, la préparation et la vente de haricot dans un petit marché de la place. Afin de pérenniser son commerce et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du haricot, du charbon  de bois, de la farine et de l’huile. Les profits réalisés l’aideront ainsi à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mrs. Ami Z. is married and has seven people in her care. As her main business, she buys, prepares, and sells beans at a small local market. In order to make her business run year-round and to increase her sales, she is seeking a loan to stock beans, charcoal, flour, and oil. The profit from her business will thus help in the development of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell beans

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married. She sells agriculture products in small markets neighboring her city. She uses her van to get to the places and sells the produce right off her van. Her net profit is 4,000 UAH per month.

She has been in this business for eight years. Her persistence and hard work have helped Nadiya to succeed and overcome competition. She has repeat clients who buy food from her every week. So, when she goes to a market people are waiting for her right there. 

Nadiya would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase her assortment. Her business goal is to open a bulk food store, providing for small business owners like her good quality food they can bring to their clients.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a married woman. She sells a variety of small home products in Khoost city. She has been in this business for 12 years. Low prices and a large assortment help her to overcome the competition. Surely being nice and smiling all the time helps her as well!! For the last couple of years, the business has become a family one. Lubov's husband and children have joined her to help in sales and deliveries.

Lubov would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Her business goal is to open a second and then third location selling similar items. This would provide jobs for her children and increase the family income.

loans.use: To open a new location

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en: Elgen L. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Elgen owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste and some variety products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elgen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elgen is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to support the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

With this loan, they can grow their businesses and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families.
