This is a gentleman who is married and the father of two. Tailoring is the income-generating business he has that enables him to provide for his family. He has been in this business for over ten years, which means he has mastered it. He also makes clothing that he displays in order to attract the attention of those passing by. He wants to buy an overcastting machine, another sewing machine, and a roll of fabrics. This is why he’s asking WAGES for his first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and some cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Maston

texts.ru: Мастон Имонова проживает в районе Руми. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Возраст 45 лет. Мастон по профессии 15 лет работала учителем. В данный момент Мастон вместе со своим супругом и старшим сыном занимаются земледелием. Они выращивают картофель и продают на рынке. Мастон хочет получить кредит и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Maston I. lives in the Rumy region. She is married and has eight children. She is 45 years old. Mason has worked as a teacher for fifteen years. At this time Maston together with her spouse and oldest son are in agriculture. They grow potatoes and sell on the market. Maston wants to get a loan and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expansion of business

loans.name: Venansia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Venansia R. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 14 and 20 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because the child is an orphan.

Venansia has been running a clothes business since 2000, selling clothes to her customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Venansia currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more clothes and expand her business. In the future, she plans to further expand her business. Venansia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and expand her business

loans.name: Saylimuhabbatkhon

texts.ru: Сайлимухаббат Сиярова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сайлимухаббатхон вместе с детьми занимается земледелием. Она выращивает картофель и продает на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Saylimuhabbat S. lives in the Rumy region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has eight children. Her husband is in Russia as a laborer. Saylimuhabbatkhon together with children are in agriculture. She grows potatoes and sells on the market. She has been in this business for more than five years. The client is asking for a loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expansion of business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina sells dried fish retail to her customers. At the time this picture was taken, she had only one dried fish left. She hopes to purchase more dried fish to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She is married with 5 children and she is 43 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase traditonal East African cloth and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to start up a vegetable garden near the river bank. Poni is 31 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: starup a vegetable garden on the river bank of the Nile

loans.name: Bahrullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Бахрулло Рахимов  занимается изготовлением и продажей кисломолочных продуктов. В ассортимент его товара входят такие продукты как кефир сметана и курут. Наверняка вы спросите что такое курут? Курут это кисло-соленные молочные шарики, которые изготавливают сам Бахрулло и его отец. Эти шарики сушат и потом продают. Изготвление курута происходит в домашних условиях. На снимке Бахрулло на фоне своего товара. Этот товар и есть курут.
В самом начале своей деятельности Бахрулло и его отец варили набот. Это сахарный сироп в виде кристалов.Затем продавали его на рынке.Но перейдя на продажу кисло молочных продуктов, он поняли что это более доходный бизнес.
Каждый день Бахрулло изготавливает 50кг курута. Кредит хочет получить для изготовления курута.
texts.en:
Bahrullo R. makes and sells products from processed milk. In his assortment of merchandise there are products such as sour cream, buttermilk and kurut. You are probably wondering what is kurut? Kurut is sour and salty milk balls which Bahrullo and his father make themselves. These balls are then dried and sold. They make kurut at home. On the photo Bahrullo is pictured with his product in the front which is kurut. In the beginning of their business Bahrullo and his father were making nabot which is a syrup made of sugar in forms of crystals. They sold it on the market. After they started selling processed milk products and realized that it's a more profitable business. Every day Bahrullo makes 50 kilograms of kurut. He wants to get a loan to produce more kurut.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce processed milk products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various items for her cafe.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru: Раджабов Садриддин проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Садриддин работает по своей профессии портным. Этой деятельности занимается более 25 лет. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить машинку.
texts.en:
Sadriddin R. lives in the Rumy district. He is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. Sadriddin works as a tailor. He has been involved in this business for over 25 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase a sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells provisions like tissue paper, bathing soap, beverages, etc. She is married, has 4 children and she is 40 years old. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva loan lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase more potatoes.

loans.name: Kibrie

texts.ru: Бакаева Кибрие проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Кибрие по специальности медсестра, но по специальности не работала. Она более 4 лет работает портнихой. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить сырье для предоставления качественных услуг.
texts.en:
Kibrie B. lives in the Rumy district. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Kibrie is a nurse by profession, but has not worked in her field. She has been working as a tailor for over 4 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni F. is currently in the business of selling paste and sorghum and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of sorghum to sell. Poni is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her store

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат Бакаева проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Каромат по профессии учитель, но ей не работала. Каромат вместе с супругом и с отцом работают портнихами. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить новую машинку.
texts.en:
Karomat B. lives in the Rumy district. She is 38 years old, married and has 6 children. Karomat is a teacher by profession, but never worked in that field. Karomat, her husband and her father work as tailors. Karomat is requesting this loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Sabina A. from Mbeya. She is married, with three children between the ages of 6 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent, a girl who is an orphan.

Sabina has been running a cereals business since 1995, purchasing and selling cereals. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about $90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more cereals in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sabina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals in bulk for her business

loans.name: Hushvaht

texts.ru: Таджиев Хушвахт проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Хушвахт по профессии более 10 лет работает гидротехником. В данный момент более 20 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает овощи и бахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Hushvaht T. lives in the Rumy region. He is married and has four children. Hushvaht has worked as a hydro technical engineer for more than ten years. At this time he has been in agriculture for more than twenty years. He grows vegetables and melons. The client is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie G. and her family live happily in the simple village of Tandul, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is now 34 years old and married to Ramon. They have three children: Nomar - 12 years old; Mark Jay - 8 years old; and Ceyan - 2 years old. Her two eldest children are studying in the elementary school.

Leslie manages both a store and a hog-raising business to provide her family with enough of their basic needs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital to sustain both of her businesses. For ten years now, Leslie has been able to maintain her businesses despite the many challenges she has been through. She wants her businesses to grow for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: To use as business capital for both of her businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothes and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Lorine

texts.en:
Lorine manages a hog-raising business. He also operates a tricycle transport in order to earn a daily income to support his hog-raising business.  He patiently pursues raising hogs for he would like to give his family a better living. He is glad to have both his hog-raising and transport business because it really helps his family a lot with their basic necessities. He is requesting to borrow loan from lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy at least another piglet and feed to sustain his business and hopes to be able to expand somehow. 

His family humbly resides in Barangay Tandul of Cabatuan, Isabela. These residents in the village work very hard towards improvement of their daily living. He is married to Analita, a plain housewife. Unluckily, they have not been able to have a child. The couple still is thankful for having a healthy living and a livelihood to provide them with a daily living.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Bekpulat

texts.ru: Таджиев Бекпулат проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Бекпулат по профессии является агрономом. В данный момент он более 25 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Bekpulat T. lives in the Rumy district. He is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. Bekpulat is an agronomist by profession. He has been involved in agriculture for over 25 years and mainly grows melon plants. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase mineral perticides.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral pesticides

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She also sells pepper soup. She is married, has 4 children and she is 46 years old. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is already 33 years old. She is married to Ronald D., a farmer. They have two children who are: Kenneth, 9 years old, and Kimberly, 6 years old. They are both in their primary level of education at Barangay Tandul Elementary School. She has managed a typical village store business for almost 9 years now and also sells vegetable in her store. Prior to her current business, Maribel first became a market vendor in their public market of Cabatuan. But due to financial difficulties, Maribel was not able to continue her market vending. Instead, she shifted opening a general store business to still earn a daily income. Now, she is requesting to borrow loan amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to develop her business towards the education of her children. She hopes to sell more items in her store and be able to develop her business to progress.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has managed a general store business for more than a year now. She is already 29 years old and married to Benjie D. M. who operates a tricycle transport business. They have two children; her eldest is already in the first grade of elementary while the second child enters kindergarten. She hope to improve her business in a different way to become productive said Marites. 

In her store, Marites is able to generate a weekly income of PHP 1,000. Aside from that, Marites also operates a school canteen every school day and earns an added income of PHP 150. Her desire to have a progressive and sustainable business motivates her to seek financial assistance from KIVA lender requesting the amount of PHP 13,000 as additional working capital. She knows it is of big help to her business towards the fulfillment of her children’s dreams for the future.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Юсупов Али проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сыновья работают в России. Али более 15 лет работал  по специальности шофером. В данный момент занимается животноводством, он откармливает бычков и продает. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 20 лет. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков.
texts.en:
Ali U. lives in the Rumy district. He is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. His sons work in Russia. Ali had worked as a driver for over 15 years. Now he is involved in animal husbandry. He feeds bulls and sells them. He has been in this business for over 20 years. Ali is requesting this loan in order to buy bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulls

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en: Ruel is a good father and husband to his 2 kids. He is a responsible husband to his wife, Virgie. Their two children are both still young, aged 3 and 1 year old. The family stays harmoniously in the rural village of Tandul in Cabatuan Isabela. People in the village are very kind and courteous and they also have clean surroundings and good camaraderie. Ruel is already 35 years old and operates a tricycle transport business to generate a daily income for his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 for his motorcycle maintenance. Ruel is an optimistic person and is used to believing that “In everything we do we must put God first”.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance.

loans.name: Rosemire

texts.en:
“Patience is very important in running a business,” said Rosemire N., a 25-year-old charcoal vendor. She is married to Redentor who is a helper in San Miguel Corporation and they are already blessed with a baby boy who is now six weeks old.

Her mother convinced Rosemire to seek the support of Kiva lenders in maintaining her charcoal-vending business. She wants it to become a successful livelihood in the future in order to give her children a better living. They are living in a simple Barangay of Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela. In the village, Rosemire simply pursues being a charcoal vendor. She retails the product at a higher price in order to assists her husband with their daily needs.

For her business to grow and become productive, Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 as additional working capital to her charcoal-vending business.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Razok

texts.ru: Шерназаров Разок проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Старшие сыновья работают в России. Разок по специальности колхозник. В данный момент более 28 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает бычков, а потом продает их. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков.
texts.en:
Razok S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 51 years, married and has 5 children. His older sons work in Russia. Razok is a farmer by trade. He is currently involved in animal husbandry and has over 28 years of experience in this field. He feeds bulls and then sells them. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Shahanie

texts.en:
Shahanie is engaged in a general store business and is asking to borrow PHP 7,000 from the lenders. She considers the amount to be a big help towards the development of her business. She has also managed a livestock business (hog raising) for already five years. She is hoping that, through the amount she expects to obtain, she will someday be able to expand her business into a bigger one so that she will be able to increase her daily income.

Shahanie is now 31 years of age and is married to Jerry S., a construction worker in their town. They are blessed with three children namely: Jerric - 12 years old; Joanna Camille - 10 years old; and their youngest, Sherry Mae - 5 years old. Shahanie wants a better life for her children and is thus doing her best to become successful in her chosen livelihood project.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito G. is married to Marina who is a domestic helper in Taiwan. He manages a hog-raising business and a rice farm to help her provide their family with better living in the future and to sustain the education of their two children namely: Maiden Wella - 21 years old and Wilmar Grace - 15 years old. They live simply in the village of Tandul, which is a rural and peaceful area of Cabatuan, Isabela.

Warlito’s business has already existed for about ten years now and he wants the business to grow more to give his children all their needs and to save for their future. He is asking to borrow PHP 5,000 as additional business capital to purchase enough feed for him to raise his pigs to grow healthy.

loans.use: To purchase enough feed for him to raise his pigs to grow healthy

loans.name: Holmumin

texts.ru: Раджабов Холмумин проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 32 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Холмумин более 12 лет работал по специальности педагогом. В данный момент он более 12 лет занимается земледелием. Холмумин в основном выращивает овощи ибахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горюче смазочные материалы.
texts.en:
Holmumin R. lives in the Rumy district. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. Holmumin used to work as a teacher for over 12 years. He is currently involved in agriculture and has over 12 years of experience in this field. Holmumin mainly grows vegetables and melon plants. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase mineral pesticides and oil and lubricants.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral pesticides and oil and lubricants

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Clara M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 4 children, between the ages of 19 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because they are orphans. 

Clara has been running a stationery business since 2008. Stationery sales is a business in which micro-entrepreneurs demonstrate their business savvy, with most sellers placing their shops, stalls, or tables strategically close to post offices, banks, schools and universities. Shops usually sell a variety of items from pens to books to candy (especially if the shop is nearby a school).

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Clara currently earns about 70 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stationery items in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another stationery shop. Clara thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stationery items in bulk.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza O. runs a hog raising business in their village. She is now 21 years old and married to Alex, who is construction worker. Aiza wants to provide their future children with a good education and a progressive living someday. Thus, the couple has joined hands to develop their poor living situation. She is requesting to borrow from lenders a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 as additional working capital in order to maintain her hog raising business and to be able to finance the animal feed supply. Aiza also is hoping that her business will become bigger and she will be able to develop a good family with harmonious relationships, especially when they will have the children they long for, to complete their family in the future. She prays that her loan will be granted soon to further develop her business to progress.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is already 58 years old. She sells native cakes (glutinous snacks) in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City. She is a mother with strong determination. She has been able to raise her children alone and sustain her family’s daily needs through her hard work and patience in vending her cook snacks. She says that she needs additional vending capital for her to gain bigger income in order to continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to KIVA lenders as financial assistance in her vending business. “This amount will already be a big help,” Hilda further said.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan T. is currently in the business of selling sorghum and maize. She is requesting a loan to stock more sorghum and maize to sell. Juan is 29 years old and is married, with a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum stock to sell.

loans.name: Bellie

texts.en:
Bellie A. is from the village of Dulong, Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Bellie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bellie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fish, shrimp and snack foods. She also cooks and sells snack foods like sweet potato and fried banana. Bellie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bellie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bellie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bellie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик Сориев проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 27 лет. Холост живет вместе с отцом. Абдумалик более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и горючее для посева рисовых плантаций. На полученный доход хочет сыграть свадьбу.
texts.en:
Abdumalik S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 27 years, single and lives with his father. Abdumalik has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He mainly grows melon plants. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy mineral pesticides and fuel to plant rice. He wants to use the resulting profit for his wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral pesticides and fuel

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is already 58 years old. She sells native cakes (glutinous snacks) in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City. She is a mother of strong determination because she was able to raised her children alone and sustain her family’s daily needs through her hard work and patience in vending her cooked snacks.

Hilda said that she needs additional vending capital for her to gain a bigger income to continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders as financial assistance in her vending business. This amount will really be a big help, Hilda further said.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Joduku M. is currently in the business of selling plastic plates and cups at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase and stock more is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy would like to avail a loan amounting of PHP 4,000 from KIVA lenders to utilize in her snack vending business in the village of Divisoria Santiago City. Her husband sells “taho” (processed soya beans), made as morning snacks especially for children. According to Juvy, “taho” is a healthy snack for children and is rich in protein. Juvy is hoping to improve her business for the improvement of their daily living. Furthermore, Juvy aims to send all her children in school for them to have a better future someday. She believes that having the loan she is requesting will be a big help towards the success of her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lysan

texts.en:
Lysan J. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Lysan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lysan owns & operates a food stall situated near the school where she sells meats, snacks & other delicacies. Lysan has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lysan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lysan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lysan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income to the family and to improve the house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: ama D. dite oumy est une femme mariée née en 1960 à thies ;elle a en charge six enfants et vit avec son mari à som;son activité consiste à acheter du poisson fumé à joal et la revendre au mali ,elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de dix ans ;elle est à son cinquième pret;après ce financement ,elle envisage d'augmenter son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Ama D., also called Oumy, is a married woman who was born in 1960 in Thies. She has six children in her care and lives with her husband in Som. Her business involves buying smoked fish in Joal and reselling them in Mali. She has been in this business for over ten years. She is on her fifth loan. Following this financing, she envisions boosting her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Abraikul

texts.ru: Абрайкул Раджабов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абрайкул 10 лет работал по специальностью, трактористом. Теперь как 10 лет занимается земледелием, т.е. выращивает бахчевые растения и рис. Клиент просит кредит, чобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее для посева рисовых плантаций.
texts.en:
Abraikul R. lives in the Rumy region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Abraikul worked for 10 years in his profession as a tractor driver. For 10 years he has been working in agriculture, growing melons and rice. The client is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer and fuel to plant rice plantations.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of African traditional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is already 45 years old. She is engaged in a buying and selling business of different junk materials, subject for recycling, in their village. She buys empty bottles and empty cans in their village. Teresita would like to ask for financial assistance from lenders, in order to improve her buy and sell business, the amount of PHP 4,000 so that she can buy more recycling materials. She is hoping and praying that her requested loan will be granted. Teresita is married to Leonardo B. Sr. He is a construction worker at the moment. They are blessed with four children: Benigno - 23 years old, college graduate, Bernardo - 21 years old, high school graduate, Leonardo B. Jr. - 18 years old and Joana Marie - 14 years old, a high school student. Teresita really is doing her best to earn higher income in order to support the education of her children with the support of her husband.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris sells second hand clothes of various colours and sizes. She is married with a child and she is 42 years old. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva loan lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cafe basics like rice,sugar, salt and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Divisoria, of Santiago City, is the place where Violeta S. and her family are living. She is now 42 years old and she is engaged into a buy and sells business such empty bottles and cans, plastic, aluminum, etc. She is seeking financial support from ASKI in the amount of PHP 4,000 as additional working capital to be able to maintain her buy and sell business. The loan amount will allow her daily income to double if her loan will be approved. This will enable her to continuously finance the education of her children.

 Violeta is married to Danilo S.. They are blessed with four children: Kathlyn - 23 years old, Val - 19 years old, Juvy - 13 years, and Maritess - 10 years old. With her four children, Violeta gets strength to work harder and also has the support of her husband. Her family is very cooperative and she hopes that their family bonding will work even stronger.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Камолов Абдулмумин проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. По специальности работал колхозником, более 30 лет. В данный момент занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 6 лет. клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить мелко-рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Abdulmumin K. lives in the Rumy region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He worked in his profession as a collective farmer for more than 30 years. Right now he raises livestock; he fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 6 years. The client is asking for a loan to purchase small-horned livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Ejike

texts.en:
Ejike E. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, meat, etc. at the resturant. She is requesting a loan to buy more chairs and tables for enough accommodation.  Ejike is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bulk inventory for her shop.

loans.name: El Hadji Madicke

texts.fr:
el hadji madické G. est un jeune marchand ambulant né en 1988 à thies;il fait du petit commerce de pantalons,de tee shirts et des  articles pour femmes qu'il achète à dakar pour le revendre sur le marché de thiès
avec ce pret ,il envisage de renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
El Hadji Madické G. is a young itinerant merchant who was born in 1988 in Thiès. He does small-scale commerce in pants, T-shirts, and women's goods that he buys in Dakar to resell in the market of Thiès. With this loan, he envisions boosting his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A small business

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.ru: Садиков Махмадсаид проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Старшие  сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Махмадсаид более 15 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить мелко рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Mahmadsaid S. lives in the Rumi region. He is 49 years old, married and has five children. His eldest son is in Russia in search of a job. Mahmadsaid has been engaged in livestock breeding for more than 15 years. He raises and sells cattle. The client is requesting a loan in order to buy dairy cows.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cows

loans.name: Mora

texts.en:
Mora J. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Mora is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 1 child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta E., 46 years old, lives at Capocao Proper, Ozamiz City. She has five children, three of whom are working. The other two are fully dependent and live together with her and her husband. She started her business in 2000 with her own capital. The customers, for her business, are from her neighborhood. Her business maintains good sales up to the present. The meager income supports their daily needs. She wants to take a loan from Paglaum in the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional capital for her sari-sari store. 

And now she wants to develop her business with the help of KIVA financing through Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: Additional capital for her  Sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали Хузмирзоенв проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. По специальности Шерали колхозник. В данный момент более 21 года он занимается животноводством. В этом ему помогают его сыновья. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить мелко рогатый скот для открма и продажи.
texts.en:
Sherali H. lives in the Rumi region. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. By specialty, Sherali is a collective farmer. At the present moment, he has been engaged in livestock raising for more than 21 years. He is helped in this work by his sons. The client is requesting a loan in order to purchase small-horn cattle to raise and sell.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small-horn cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase long hair, razor and hair dryer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of African traditional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Marie Therese Yacine

texts.fr: marie therese est une jeune femme née en 1976 à dakar et habite au quartier mbour 1 à thies ;elle est divorcée et est mère d'un enfant qui est à sa charge ;pour gérer le quotidien ,elle fait du commerce de parfums et d'encens ,avec le pret qu'elle demande ,elle veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Marie Therese is a young woman who was born in 1976 in Dakar and lives in the Mbour district in Thies. She is divorced and the mother of one child who is in her care. To manage in life from day to day, she does commerce in perfumes and incense. With this loan she's requesting, she wants to boost her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell perfume

loans.name: Akpomudje

texts.en: H. sells soft drinks and foodstuff. She has been in this business for the past two years. She needs a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuff so as to meet the demand of customers. H. is 52 years old and married, with two children. She promise to pay back and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream. She is married with five children and she is 29 years old. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Tausi G. from Mwanza. She is married with one child who is 6 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Tausi has been running a clothing business since 2007. Her business is selling clothes to the customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Tausi currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more clothes and to increase her capital. In the future, she plans to open another business. Tausi thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and to increase her capital.

loans.name: Adeeyo

texts.en: A. is a member of LAPO. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and baking items to sell in order to meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and baking items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Eva R. from Mwanza. She is married with five children between the ages of 22 and 27 years old. Eva has been running a poultry business since 2002. Her business is the poultry/kuku business. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 
She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Eva currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to expand her business. In the future, she plans to renovate her poultry house. Eva thanks you for your support!




ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase equipment for breaking stones

loans.name: Athel

texts.en: Athel, 41, sells second-hand clothes.  She is married with four children.  Athel hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maston

texts.ru: Баротова Мастон проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Мастон более 15 лет занимается растениводством. Она в основном выращивает рисовые растения. Муж работает водителем маршрутного такси. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
49-year-old Maston B. lives in the Rumi region. She is married and has eight children. Maston has been growing vegetables for more than 15 years. In general, she grows rice plants. Her husband works as a shuttle taxi driver. The client is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Salimiti

texts.en:
Salimiti is 49 year old, from Mwanza. She is married with six children all between the ages of 13 and 18

Salimiti has run a poultry business since 2003. Raising Kuku (chicken in Swahili) is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. They require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! They require little space, so you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. While they grow they produce eggs, which can be sold to supplement her income or eaten to provide a source of protein.

She works at the business 12 hours a day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Salimiti earns about $140 from her business. She requests a loan of $400 to purchase more chickens. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Salimiti thanks you for your support!

-------------------------------- ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase chickens.

loans.name: Messia

texts.en:
This is 44 years old Messia M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children, between the ages of 14 and 20. She also supports two dependents who are orphans. Messia has run a charcoal business since 1996; Charcoal comes from small, black pieces of dry earth used to cook meals. Women cook food in small coal pots. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative! She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days a week. Messia earns about $60 a month. She requests a loan in order to purchase more charcoal in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Messia thanks you for your support!

-------------------------- ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Buki

texts.en: F. buys refrigerators from the manufacturer at a discount and sells retail.  She has been in this business since 2007 and needs a loan of N140,000 to increase her inventory.  F. is 45 years old, married and has three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerators to sell.

loans.name: Mansurbek

texts.ru: Джаборов мансурбек проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Мансурбек более 9 лет занимается растениводством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые и рисовые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
Mansurbek J. lives in the Rumi region. He is 29 years old, married and has two children. For more than nine years, Mansurbek has been involved in growing vegetables. He is most involved in growing melons and rice plants. The client is requesting a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ogbonna

texts.en: E. goes to Cotonu once every two weeks, buys apples in cartons and supplies them to  roadside sellers who retail them to consumers. She needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more cartons of apples.  E. is 42 years old, married with two children.

loans.use: Purchase apples to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more raw materials to make more bites.

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru: Холмурод давлатов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Холмурод более 30 лет занимается растениводством. Он выращивает бахчевые и рисовые растения. В этом ему также помогает его семья. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
Holmurod D. lives in the Rumy district. He is 50 years old, married and has 9 children. Holmurod has been involved in agriculture for over 30 years. He grows melon and rice plants. His family also helps him with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer for sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This is 31 year old Halima M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 12 and 14. Halima has run a clothes business since 2007 that sells to women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days a week. Halima earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more clothes to resell to customers. In the future she plans to open the same business in a different place. Halima thanks you for your support!

--------------------------- ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica L. is from Camp Phillips, Agusan Canyon. She is 33 years old. Monica is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns and operates a food stall. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Monica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI to expand her business. Monica is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Monica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue from the business to support the education of children.

-------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding her business.

loans.name: Zefanias Armando

texts.pt:
Zefanias de 31 anos nasceu no distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, estudou até sétima classe e teve de parar com os estudos por falta de condições financeiras. Casado e pai de dois filhos de 12 e 06 anos e todos são estudantes. Vive na casa dos pais com esposa e filhos.

Comerciante e mais de 10 anos e dono do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 2,500.00MT a 4,500.00MT.

É pela primeira vez que pede empréstimo a Hluvuku, com o valor de 15,000.00MT, pretende aumentar o stock de produtos para maior diversificação e consequentemente maiores vendas.
texts.en:
Zefanias is 31 years old and was born in the Chibuto district in the province of Gaza. He attended school through seventh grade, when he had to abandon his studies because of financial difficulties. He is married and the father of two children, 12 and 6 years old, who are both in school. He lives in his parents' house with his wife and children. He is a merchant and has owned his own business for 10 years. He has no employees. He sells staple goods that he purchases in the wholesale market in Maputo. He earns between 2500 and 4500 MT a day. This is his first loan request with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 MT. He intends to increase his stock of merchandise to have a greater variety and thus increase his sales.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima sells second hand clothes of various colors and sizes. She is married with two children.  Chidima is 25 years old.  She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Vasco's Group

texts.pt:
Sandra de 40 anos nasceu no distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, estudou até terceira classe e abandonou cedo por falta de condições financeiras. Casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos de 22 e 8 anos, respectivamente e ambos estudam. Vive na casa própria com marido e filhos.

Saiu de Chibuto com marido a sensivelmente 20 anos, tendo se fixado no distrito de Boane.

É Comerciante a mais de 2 anos e dona do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Trabalha 10 hrs por dia e vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 350.00MT a 500.00MT.

É pela primeira vez que pede empréstimo a Hluvuku, com o valor de 15,000.00MT, pretende aplicar nas obras de construção da residência familiar compra de cimento e aros de janelas.

Seu sonho é ter as obras da casa terminadas e daí poderá fazer outros projectos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 40 years old, was born in Chibuto district, Gaza province. She studied at school until third grade, then left school early due to a lack of financing. She is married and has two children, aged 22 and 8 respectively, both of whom are students. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. Sandra left Chibuto with her husband 20 years ago and settled in the district of Boane. She has been a merchant for more than two years and owns her own business; she has no employees. She works ten hours a day selling basic necessities, buying bulk in the city of Maputo. Her daily income varies between 350 MT and 500 MT. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from Hluvuku. She plans to apply this amount of 15,000 MT to construction work on her family home to buy cement and window frames. Her dream is to have the work on her house finished and then to be able to do other projects.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, maize, beans and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase salon materials in bulk for her business

loans.name: Olga Mário

texts.pt:
Olga de 31 anos nasceu no distrito de Chokwé, Província de Gaza, estudou até sexta classe e abandonou cedo por falta de condições financeiras. Casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos de 12,7 e 1 ano, respectivamente e dois vão a escola. Vive na casa própria com marido e filhos.

Saiu de Chokwé com a mãe por cauda da guerra civil, tendo se transferido para Boane, onde ela veio conhecer o marido com que compartilha a vida até hoje.

É Comerciante a mais de 5 anos e dona do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Trabalha 10 hrs por dia e vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 500.00MT a 900.00MT.

Seu parceiro financeiro foi sempre a Hluvuku, sendo seu terceiro empréstimo. Com o empréstimo de 11,000.00MT, pretende aumentar o stock de produtos para maior diversificação e consequentemente maiores vendas.

Seu sonho é crescer mais no negocio e ampliar a residência familiar.
texts.en:
Olga, 31 years old, was born in the district of Chokwé, Gaza province. She studied until sixth grade, but gave up school early due to a lack of financing. She is married and has three children, 12, 7 and 1 year old, respectively, two of whom go to school. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. She left Chokwé with her mother because of the civil war and moved to Boane, where she met her husband with whom she shares her life still today. Olga has been a merchant for over five years and owns her own business. She does not have employees. She works ten hours a day selling basic necessities, buying in bulk in the city of Maputo. Her daily income varies between 500 MT and 900 MT. Her financial partner has always been Hluvuku; this is her third loan. With this loan of 11,000 MT, she plans to increase her stock of merchandise for greater diversification and, consequently, larger sales. Her dream is to expand her business and to build on to her family home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth J. is from the town of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Maribeth is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a business selling cosmetic products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beauty products like hand and body lotion, perfumes and other beauty accessories to tourists and local community members. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Luís Jeremias

texts.pt:
Luís de 38 anos nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, estudou até quinta classe e teve de parar por problemas de guerra civil que Moçambique viveu durante 16 anos. Casado maritalmente e pai de quatro filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 7 e 14 anos e todos são estudantes. Vive na casa própria e Sustenta também os seus pais que vivem com ele.

Comerciante e mais de 6 anos e dono do próprio negócio, não tem empregados. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e sua aquisição é no mercado grossista da cidade de Maputo, seu rendimento diário oscila entre 500.00MT a 700.00MT.

Seu parceiro financeiro foi sempre a Hluvuku, sendo seu terceiro empréstimo. Com o empréstimo de 14,000.00MT, pretende aumentar o stock de produtos para maior diversificação e consequentemente maiores vendas.

Seu sonho é crescer mais no negocio, sendo uma das prioridades a transformação da barraca em loja.
texts.en:
Luís, 38 years old, was born in the district of Boane, Maputo province. He studied at school until fifth grade, and then had to stop due to the civil war which Mozambique lived through for 16 years. He is married and the father of four children aged 7 to 14 years, all of whom are students. He lives in his own house and also supports his parents, who live with him. He has been a merchant for over six years and owns his own business. He has no employees. He sells basic necessities, buying in bulk in the city of Maputo. His daily income varies between 500 MT and 700 MT. His financial partner has always been Hluvuku, this is his third loan. With this loan of 14,000 MT, he plans to increase his stock of merchandise for greater diversification and, consequently, more sales. His dream is to expand his business more. One of his priorities is the transformation of his stall into a shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy small fish and sell them.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
Matilde de 35 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até quarta classe sendo o motivo de baixa escolarização a morte dos pais quando ela ainda era criança é mãe solteira e tem 4 filhos de 16,10,8 e 5 anos, respectivamente. Vive na casa própria.

É comerciante a mais de 5 anos e dona do seu próprio negocio, tendo aprendido a actividade por imperativos da vida. Vende produtos frescos no mercado local e suas vendas diárias oscilam entre 500.00MT a 700.00MT.

Este é o quarto empréstimo, e nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de microfinanças, sendo única parceira a Hluvuku. Com o valor emprestado pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria e diversificar os produtos de venda.

Futuramente pretende ter água canalizada e construir muro de vedação da sua residência e conta ter mais empréstimos com a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Matilde, 35 years old, was born in the city of Maputo. She studied at school until fourth grade. The reason she had so little education was the death of her parents when she was still a child. She is a single mother and has four children, 16, 10, 8 and 5 years old, respectively. She lives in her own house. Matilde has been a merchant for more than five years and owns her own business. Learning this trade was a matter of survival. She sells fresh produce in the local market and her daily sales vary between 500 MT and 700 MT. This is her fourth loan. She has never worked with other microfinancing institutions, but has only worked with Hluvuku. With this loan she plans to increase the volume of her merchandise and diversify the products she sells. In the future, she plans to have indoor plumbing and to build a weather-proof wall for her home. She counts on having more loans from Hluvuku.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tto buy more crops for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and soda.

loans.name: Ekaete

texts.en: Ekaete L. sells provisions like milk, sugar, noodles, etc. She is married with three children and she is 36 years old. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mawéana

texts.fr: Cette femme est veuve, et a sa charge ses 03 enfants, afin de subvenir convenablement à leur besoins elle  a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois et de céréales, elle réalise une grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes car elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays où le sac de charbon de bois et le bol de maïs est moins coûteux. Son stock a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois et 10 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow who has three children in her care. To provide for them appropriately, she started doing commerce in charcoal and in grains. She realizes a large profit margin on her sales because, to supply herself, she goes inland where a sack of charcoal or a bowl of corn is less expensive. With her inventory diminished, she wants to stock up again and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy fifteen sacks of charcoal and ten sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie V. is from the town of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Emelie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emelie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She also sells a variety of snack products and candies. Emelie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de bè-plage qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle vend à des couturières et tailleurs. Le stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de couvrir la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 rouleaux de tissus popelines et des tissus. Avec le revenu de son commerce  elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Akou A. is a resident of the Bé-Plage quarter, a central quarter of the city of Lomé. She is a married mother of one child. She generates a living through her cloth-making and fabrics business, selling to tailors and dress-makers. The stock that she currently is insufficient to meet the demand of her clientele; therefore she is requesting from WAGES a loan to buy two rolls of poplin fabric and other fabrics. With the revenue from her business she plans to contribute to helping with the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Beatrice S. from Mwanza. Beatrice has been running a shop selling soaps, maize flour and sugar since 1998. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Beatrice is married with one child, age one years old. In addition, she is responsible for supporting one dependant whose parents do not take care of him.

Beatrice currently earns about $160 US from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 US in order to purchase rice, beans and maize flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Beatrice thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes L. makes a living primarily from selling a variety of pre-packed snack products, candies, canned goods and daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 44 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. Mercedes has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mercedes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedes is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a specialized retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Neema M. from Mwanza. She is single with one child, age 2.5 years old. Neema has been running a beauty salon since 2008. Her business is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, or blue hair and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.
