She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Neema currently earns about $150 US from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 US in order to purchase a dryer and long hair for re-sale to customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and long hair extenders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timber for reselling

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” vive en Jr. Bolognesi Nº 659, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos estudiantes que aun dependen de ella y por ellos trabaja muy duro.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar todo lo que la ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente los atiende con alegría y entusiasmo. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, comprará diversos abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Anhela convertir su bodega en un minimarket y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo cumple.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Angélica is a member of the “Las Nazarenas” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Bellavista district of the department of San Martín. She is a 35-year-old married mother with 2 school age children, for whom she works so hard, who still depend on her.

Her enterprising character and the love she has for her family motivated her to start her own general store, which kept growing little by little. She started to gain experience in this field, making a name for herself and being well-loved by her customers. She currently has a fixed clientele who visit her shop everyday to purchase everything that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with joy and enthusiasm. With this 1,800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase various products, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, eggs, and toiletries so that she can keep providing the best customer service.

She hopes to convert her small shop into a minimarket, stating that she will achieve her goal because she is a woman who accomplishes whatever she sets out to do.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods (rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, canned fish, toiletries)

loans.name: Zarah Mae

texts.en:
Zarah Mae C. is from the town of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Zarah Mae is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Zarah Mae runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Zarah Mae is just starting this business.

In 2009, Zarah Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zarah Mae is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Zarah Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Sophia N. from Mwanza. She is married with one child who is 1 year old. Since 2002, Sophia has owned a video store that she runs with the assistance of her husband. In addition to renting out movie videos to customers, they also work as videographers. At occasions like weddings and birthdays, they are available to record the special occasion for posterity! 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sophia currently earns about $300 per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more cassettes and sell them to her customers. In the future, she plans to add more cassettes. Sophia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cassettes and sell them to her customers

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Juana Rafaela A., tiene la edad de 61 años, reside en el barrio Acahualinca en la capital de Managua, casada y con ochos hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es cadete de taxi, su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, lleva cuarenta años en las ventas, el cual inicio con capital propio y con necesidad de invertir mas, con este préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su humilde casa y poder tener una casa digna. Sus planes en el negocio es seguir comprando pacas para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de ropa a buen precio.
texts.en:
Juana Rafaela A. is 61 years old and she lives in the Acahualinca region of the capital city of Managua. She is married and has eight grown children. Her husband is a taxi driver and her business is selling second hand clothing. She has been selling for fourty years, a business she started with her own savings. She sees a need to invest further. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to finish building her humble home so that she might have a dignified home. Her plans are to keep purchasing packages of clothing to provide her clients with the variety of clothing they seek at a good price.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase trees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn engages in buying and selling of gold dust from traditional gold miners in her village. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of bought gold dust to the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP (US$175), which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan Jocelyn has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her gold dust business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Agness M. from Mbeya. She is married with one 7-year-old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one orphaned dependent. 

Agness has been running a beauty salon business since 2002. Her business is the place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down.  Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Agness currently earns about 90 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her salon. In the future, she plans to open another salon. Agness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open her own store for her business.

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es:
Yoli tiene un vehiculo del cual recibe ingresos por el servicio de transporte, y también trabaja como empleada en el supermercado Hipermaxi.
Es Soltera e independiente y los ingresos son para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, vivienda, y educación.
Vive en la Zona de Villa San Antonio bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de repuestos y reparación de su vehículo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de poder acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Yoli owns a car through which she earns an income by providing public transport. She is also and employee of the Hipermaxi supermarket.

She is single and independent and she uses her income to cover her expenses such as food, housing and education.

She lives in the Villa San Antonio region in the city of La Paz and she rents a house there.

This loan will be used toward the purchase of spare parts and for the repair of her vehicle.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner). Her wish to improve herself has led her to request this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the repair of her car used as public transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo, sus hijos de 15 años y un pequeño de 3 añitos en su casa propia. Con el afán de brindarle a su familia lo mejor, ha tratado de incursionar en todo tipo de negocio para llevar ingresos a su hogar, ya que a pesar de que su esposo trabaja y solventa los gastos, a Zaida le gusta ser independiente. Por ello trabaja desde su hogar, y al tener un hijo pequeño que cuidar optó por preparar almuerzos para los comerciantes del mercado que está cerca de a domicilio. Todos los días en su casa prepara los deliciosos platillos que ofrece a sus clientes, los que previamente le hacen pedidos, por lo que prepara cantidades exactas para no tener pierde, resultándole muy rentable su negocio. A ella le gusta mucho cocinar y gracias a su empeño logró comprar algunos artefactos electrodomésticos que le facilitan el preparado de los alimentos. Zaida tiene muchas esperanzas de progresar y sabe que de seguir así, podrá hacer crecer y consolidar su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y le resulta muy grato el trabajo en su grupo, ya que entre todas sus compañeras son muy buenas amigas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará alimentos al por mayor; como sacos de aceite, arroz, harina y otros, además de aceite por litros. De esta manera los costos son más bajos y sus ganancias serán mayores.
texts.en:
Zaida is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and her children, aged 15 and a little one, 3 years old. They live in their own home. With the goal of providing her family with the best she has tried every kind of business to generate an income. Eventhough her husband works and covers the family's expenses Zaida likes to be independent. She she has a litte one in her care she works from home making breakfasts for the workers in the market near her home. She prepares delicious foods every day for her clients. She takes orders from them ahead of time to avoid wastes and to make her business more profitable. She loves to look and thanks to her hard work she has managed to purchase appliances that help her in the preparation of her food. Zaide has high hopes for improvement and she knows that if she keeps up her business she will be able to expand her business. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been on time with her payments and she loves working with the group, especially because they are all colleagues and good friends. With the funds she is requesting she will purchase wholesale foods, such as cooking oil, rice, flour and other items. This way she will reduce her costs and improve her earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam P. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Meriam is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Meriam sells different varieties of bananas in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Meriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make more bricks in bulk

loans.name: Horacio Alexander

texts.es: El señor Horacio Bermúdez, reside en el barrio Barcelona en la capital de Managua, tiene 42 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos que su esposa procreo, dos están estudiando y uno trabaja y ayuda con los gastos. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su vivienda. El se desempeña de fotógrafo y venta de estilaje deportivo, tiene veinte años de experiencia y inicio con préstamos en financieras, con este crédito va a compra material para trabajar en fotografía como en estilaje deportivo. Su meta es poder montar su propio estudio fotográfico. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios que hasta ahora ha logrado con los préstamos en el ramo de su negocio este es su sexto ciclo y espera poder seguir trabajando con el financiamiento para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Horacio B. lives in the Barcelona region in the capital city of Managua. He is 42 years old, is married and has three children. Two of them are studying and one is working and helps out with the expenses. His plans are to finish building their home. He is a photographer. He has been in business twenty years and he started out with bank loans. With this loan he will purchase products for his photography. His goal is to set up his own photography studio. He is grateful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) for help he has received. This is his sixth loan and hopes to keep up his financing to meet his goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for photography

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed O., age 54, is a tailor by profession. He works in a shop in the market square. Currently Mohammed has two apprentices. He has been in business for 25 years and is full of rich experiences. He wants a loan to buy materials in bulk.

Mohammed is married and the father of eight children: five sons and three daughters. His wife is a trader. All of Mohammed’s children are still in school. Some are in senior high while others are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Doña Ángela a sus 49 años de edad, es una mujer activa, tiene un kiosco que administra desde hace siete años, vende refrescos, golosinas, comida rápida y otros productos, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad, que estudia, sus anhelo es poder hacer mejoras a su casa,  inicio este pequeño negocio con ahorros propios, da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo de sus prestamos este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic y espera invertir en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas para hacer crecer sus ventas con productos nuevos. Sus planes es poder vender variedad de productos y dar un buen servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and she is a very active person. She has been managing her stand for the past seven years, selling drinks, snacks, fast food and other products. She lives in the 380 region in the capital city of Managua. She has a 22-year old son who is currently a student. Her goal is to make improvements to her home. She started her small business with her own savings. She is grateful for the financial support of the institution. This is her fourth loan with Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) and she plans to invest in the purchase of soft drinks and snacks to expand her business with the introduction of new products. He rplans are to sell a variety of products and provide for her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. sells printed textiles and infants’ layettes. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business. 
Abena is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. She is 45 years old and divorced. Some of her children have completed school and are working. Others are still in school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles

loans.name: Jemilly

texts.en:
Jemilly B. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Jemilly is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jemilly sells a variety of bananas in the local community. She also sells firewood. Jemilly has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jemilly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jemilly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jemilly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Jemilly from HSPFI. 

"I plan to use the additional revenue generated from my business to supplement the income of my family and to support the educational needs of my children," she answered during the interview of HSPFI Kiva staff.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Mario de la Cruz Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 47 años, reside en un bario de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, casado, el negocio de don Mario es la venta de productos químicos junto a su esposa que le ayuda a vender desde hace nueve años, inicio este negocio con prestamos financieros en Afodenic es su décimo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de un caballo que le ayude a agilizar sus gestiones. Sus planes es poder mejora su casa, e incrementar su inventario para vender más y obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros obtenidos.
texts.en:
Mario de la Cruz Rodríguez is 47 years old, married, and lives in a neighborhood of Managua called Laureles Sur. Mario’s business is the sale of chemical products, which he has carried out together with his wife for the past nine years. He started his enterprise with loans with Afodemic. This is his tenth loan, which he will invest into the purchase of a horse to help him to expedite his deliveries. His plans include making improvements to his home, and to increase his inventory so he can sell more and augment his earnings. He gives thanks to the institution for the strides he’s made.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a horse to help expedite his sales.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty F. is 52 years old. She is a widow and has five children – one daughter and four sons. They live in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western region, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Gifty is a hard working woman. She sells beverages in her community in the mornings and the evenings. She serves drinks such as coffee, tea, milo, and so forth. Gifty has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to buy more provision to expand her business. She wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Aydalina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aydalina Muños, mujer trabajadora que logro poner su propio negocio una pulpería donde vende productos variados el cual administra desde cuatro años, tiene la edad de 38 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua,  su esposo es comerciante, le tiene dos hijos uno de 19 y otro de 3 años de edad, el mayor es independiente, su negocio lo inicio con dinero que su esposo dio y prestamos en Afodenic  con esto ha logrado incrementar su inventario. Con este préstamo va a comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes entre otros, para ofrecer a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder hacer grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Aydalina Muños is a hard-working woman who managed to start her own general store, where she sells a variety of products, four years ago. She is 38 years old, and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a merchant, and they have two children ages 19 and 3. The eldest is now living independently. She started her enterprise with money from her husband, as well as loans from Afodenic that have helped her to increase her inventory. With this loan, she will invest in basic grains, dairy products, meats, and other items, to offer to her customers. Her plan is to grow her store into a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and dairy products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia N. is 41 years old, married, and has one child—a son who is currently in primary school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Cecilia’s husband is a farmer. She sells cosmetics such as powder, cream, perfume, and so forth, on a tabletop at the lorry station. She also sells footwear. Cecilia buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Cecilia aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. is 45 years old, married, and has eight children—a daughter and seven sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. They live in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, millet, and so forth. Agnes buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She sells to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Agnes aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cereals
